MDU's Tiranga Yatra inspires patriotism, environmental action and drug-free pledge among youth
The Maharshi Dayanand University (MDU) campus in Rohtak was awash with patriotism during the grand Tiranga Yatra, part of the Amrit Mahotsav of Independence. Union Minister Manohar Lal inaugurated the event, administered a de-addiction oath, and emphasised youth involvement in national progress. The event highlighted patriotism, drug de-addiction, and environmental protection, with thousands participating. The yatra concluded at Jat College with cultural programmes, reinforcing youth commitment to nation-building and social harmony.
MDU's Tiranga Yatra inspires patriotism, environmental action and drug-free pledge among youth - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNewsMDU's Tiranga Yatra inspires patriotism, environmental action and drug-free pledge among youthTrendingUPSC Mains Admit CardH1B VisaHP TET June ResultPunjab Police Constable ResultHPBOSE Supplementary Exam ResultIBPS PO Admit CardUP Police RecruitmentTN TET RecruitmentIndian Navy RecruitmentRRB NTPC Admit CardUPSC Mains Admit CardH1B VisaHP TET June ResultPunjab Police Constable ResultHPBOSE Supplementary Exam ResultIBPS PO Admit CardUP Police RecruitmentTN TET RecruitmentIndian Navy RecruitmentRRB NTPC Admit CardUPSC Mains Admit CardH1B VisaHP TET June ResultPunjab Police Constable ResultHPBOSE Supplementary Exam ResultIBPS PO Admit CardUP Police RecruitmentTN TET RecruitmentIndian Navy RecruitmentRRB NTPC Admit CardMDU's Tiranga Yatra inspires patriotism, environmental action and drug-free pledge among youthSat Singh / TNN /  Aug 13, 2025, 16:35 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeThe Maharshi Dayanand University (MDU) campus in Rohtak was awash with patriotism during the grand Tiranga Yatra, part of the Amrit Mahotsav of Independence. Union Minister Manohar Lal inaugurated the event, administered a de-addiction oath, and emphasised youth involvement in national progress. The event highlighted patriotism, drug de-addiction, and environmental protection, with thousands participating. The yatra concluded at Jat College with cultural programmes, reinforcing youth commitment to nation-building and social harmony. Celebration of Tricolor in MDU: Rohtak immersed in the wave of patriotism, Union minister Manohar Lal administered the oath of de-addiction! ROHTAK: The campus of Maharshi Dayanand University (MDU) was painted in the colors of patriotism today, where the grand Tiranga Yatra gathered a huge crowd. This event was not only a part of the Amrit Mahotsav of Independence, but also became a strong medium to awaken the spirit of patriotism, de-addiction and environmental protection among the youth. Thousands of students, teachers, citizens and dignitaries took to the streets holding the tricolor in their hands, and the entire atmosphere resonated with the slogans of 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' and 'Vande Mataram'.Union Minister Manohar Lal inaugurated the yatra from Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Cricket Stadium of MDU. On this occasion, MDU Vice Chancellor Prof. Rajbir Singh, Chairperson, Rehabilitation Council of India Dr. Sharanjit Kaur, Registrar Dr. Krishan Kant, eminent doctor Dr. Aditya Batra, industrialist Rajesh Jain and many other special guests were present. Union Minister Manohar Lal said in his motivational address that the tricolor is not just a flag, but a symbol of the country's honor and pride. During the freedom struggle, lakhs of revolutionaries sacrificed their lives for its honor. He appealed to the youth to play an active role in national interest, protect the dignity of the tricolor and connect with social concerns. The minister stressed that the young generation should awaken the spirit of patriotism, so that India can become a strong and developed nation.Appreciating MDU's 'Nasha Mukt Ghar' campaign, the minister called it an important link in the nationwide drug de-addiction movement. He administered the oath of de-addiction to all the people present and said that drug addiction is hollowing out the roots of society. Apart from this, the minister gave the message of environmental protection by planting saplings in the stadium premises, which proved to be a meaningful step against climate change. By joining this campaign, the youth will not only keep themselves healthy, but will also contribute in making the society drug-free.VC Prof. Rajbir Singh, who was presiding over the program, expressed his commitment to turn the drug-free campaign into a mega campaign. He said that today there is a dire need for freedom from drugs. More than 2.50 lakh students, teachers and staff members of MDU and its affiliated 250 colleges will unite in this campaign and work towards making Haryana drug-free. The Vice Chancellor pledged to remain dedicated to this goal throughout his life, which became a big source of inspiration for the youth.Dr. Sharanjit Kaur called upon the youth to preserve the cultural heritage of the country, increase social harmony and adopt the spirit of service. He said that such events bring positive change in the society. The Tiranga Yatra passed through the university campus and reached the Shaheed Smarak at Gate No. 1, where Minister Manohar Lal paid floral tribute to the immortal martyrs. After this, the yatra reached the Jat College playground, where it concluded with patriotic songs, slogans and cultural programs. The enthusiasm of the youth was worth seeing, who not only consider the tricolor as the pride of the past but also the responsibility of the future.Thousands of people including MDU students, NSS and YRC volunteers, NCC cadets, players, campus school students, members of social organizations, BJP District President Ranbir Dhaka, President, Jat Education Society Rohtak Gulab Singh Dimana participated in this event. This Tiranga Yatra will become a source of inspiration for the coming generations and will strengthen the participation of youth in nation building. Such programs play an important role in keeping the country united and fighting social evils.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. Follow us here.Ready to navigate global policies? Secure your overseas future. Get expert guidance now!About the AuthorSat SinghSat Singh is a senior Journalist based at Rohtak. US court allows DOGE access to Education Department data: Here's how it impacts students
A U.S. appeals court has restored the Department of Government Efficiency’s (DOGE) access to Education Department databases, overturning a prior block amid privacy concerns. The ruling, tied to a broader lawsuit, impacts access to student loan data for millions. While K-12 records weren’t accessed, the decision raises ongoing debates over data privacy, government efficiency, and oversight.
US court allows DOGE access to Education Department data: Here's how it impacts students - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNewsUS court allows DOGE access to Education Department data: Here's how it impacts studentsTrendingUPSC Mains Admit CardH1B VisaHP TET June ResultPunjab Police Constable ResultHPBOSE Supplementary Exam ResultIBPS PO Admit CardUP Police RecruitmentTN TET RecruitmentIndian Navy RecruitmentRRB NTPC Admit CardUPSC Mains Admit CardH1B VisaHP TET June ResultPunjab Police Constable ResultHPBOSE Supplementary Exam ResultIBPS PO Admit CardUP Police RecruitmentTN TET RecruitmentIndian Navy RecruitmentRRB NTPC Admit CardUPSC Mains Admit CardH1B VisaHP TET June ResultPunjab Police Constable ResultHPBOSE Supplementary Exam ResultIBPS PO Admit CardUP Police RecruitmentTN TET RecruitmentIndian Navy RecruitmentRRB NTPC Admit CardUS court allows DOGE access to Education Department data: Here's how it impacts studentsApeksha Tanwar / TOI Education /  Aug 13, 2025, 16:30 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeA U.S. appeals court has restored the Department of Government Efficiency’s (DOGE) access to Education Department databases, overturning a prior block amid privacy concerns. The ruling, tied to a broader lawsuit, impacts access to student loan data for millions. While K-12 records weren’t accessed, the decision raises ongoing debates over data privacy, government efficiency, and oversight.  A recent ruling by a federal appeals court has significant implications for students across the United States. On August 12, 2025, the U.S. Court of Appeals for the 4th Circuit in Richmond, Virginia, overturned a preliminary injunction that had previously blocked the Department of Government Efficiency, or DOGE, from accessing sensitive records at the U.S. Department of Education, as well as the Treasury Department and the Office of Personnel Management. The decision restores DOGE’s access to federal databases while the broader legal challenge continues.What is DOGE and why does it matter for students? DOGE was established under the Trump administration to improve efficiency across federal agencies. The office, closely associated with Elon Musk, who served as an informal adviser to former President Trump, has employees embedded in multiple agencies to review operations and data. Although Musk stepped down from his White House role in May 2025, DOGE continues its work.According to the EdWeek, the American Federation of Teachers, along with other unions and individuals, had challenged DOGE’s access, arguing that it violated the Privacy Act of 1974 and placed sensitive data at risk. Specifically, the lawsuit noted DOGE employees accessed the Student Loan Data System, which contains records of approximately 43 million Americans, including teachers. The suit did not allege that K-12 student records were accessed.The court’s reasoning In its 2-1 decision, the 4th Circuit cited procedural issues with the lawsuit and indicated that the plaintiffs would likely have difficulty proving a violation of the Privacy Act. According to the EdWeek, Judge Julius N. Richardson, a Trump appointee, wrote that DOGE employees are tasked with a broad duty to improve agency efficiency and would find it challenging to know what needs reform without reviewing the data. Judge Richardson further noted that “each plaintiff’s information is one row in various databases that are millions upon millions of rows long,” suggesting that the potential harm from granting access to a handful of government employees differs in kind from the risks posed by reporters, investigators, or paparazzi. The majority also referenced a U.S. Supreme Court order in June that allowed DOGE employees access to Social Security Administration files, which similarly faced privacy concerns. According to the EdWeek, Richardson stated, “This case and that one are exceedingly similar”.In dissent, Judge Robert B. King, a Clinton appointee, argued that the district court had provided a thorough analysis demonstrating the plaintiffs were likely to succeed on the merits of their Privacy Act claim. He described DOGE’s access as “sudden, unfettered, unprecedented, and apparently unnecessary” and emphasised the sensitivity of the personal information involved. Implications for students For students, this ruling highlights the ongoing tension between government efficiency initiatives and the safeguarding of personal data. While K-12 records were not part of the lawsuit, the ruling still involves access to large federal education databases, which could include higher education loan records and other student-related information. It underscores the need for students and educators to remain aware of how personal data is accessed and managed at the federal level. The case is not yet fully resolved. The full 4th Circuit is expected to examine the broader implications of DOGE’s access in the Social Security Administration case in September, which may provide further clarity on the limits and oversight of such government data initiatives. As legal proceedings continue, students and education stakeholders may see changes in how government offices access and use sensitive educational and personal data, making this a topic worth monitoring closely.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. SHS Bihar ANM recruitment 2025: Apply online for 5006 vacancies at shs.bihar.gov.in before 28 August
Bihar ANM recruitment 2025: The State Health Society Bihar (SHS Bihar) has announced 5006 vacancies for Auxiliary Nurse Midwife (ANM) posts. Eligible candidates with a recognised ANM diploma can apply online at shs.bihar.gov.in from August 14 to August 28, 2025. The recruitment includes ANM (HSC), ANM (RBSK), and ANM (NUHM) posts. Detailed eligibility, age limits, and application fees are specified. The monthly salary is Rs 15,000. Candidates must register with the Bihar Nurses Registration Council to apply.
SHS Bihar ANM recruitment 2025: Apply online for 5006 vacancies at shs.bihar.gov.in before 28 August - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNewsSHS Bihar ANM recruitment 2025: Apply online for 5006 vacancies at shs.bihar.gov.in before 28 AugustTrendingUPSC Mains Admit CardH1B VisaHP TET June ResultPunjab Police Constable ResultHPBOSE Supplementary Exam ResultIBPS PO Admit CardUP Police RecruitmentTN TET RecruitmentIndian Navy RecruitmentRRB NTPC Admit CardUPSC Mains Admit CardH1B VisaHP TET June ResultPunjab Police Constable ResultHPBOSE Supplementary Exam ResultIBPS PO Admit CardUP Police RecruitmentTN TET RecruitmentIndian Navy RecruitmentRRB NTPC Admit CardUPSC Mains Admit CardH1B VisaHP TET June ResultPunjab Police Constable ResultHPBOSE Supplementary Exam ResultIBPS PO Admit CardUP Police RecruitmentTN TET RecruitmentIndian Navy RecruitmentRRB NTPC Admit CardSHS Bihar ANM recruitment 2025: Apply online for 5006 vacancies at shs.bihar.gov.in before 28 AugustSanjay Sharma / TOI Education /  Aug 13, 2025, 16:29 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeBihar ANM recruitment 2025: The State Health Society Bihar (SHS Bihar) has announced 5006 vacancies for Auxiliary Nurse Midwife (ANM) posts. Eligible candidates with a recognised ANM diploma can apply online at shs.bihar.gov.in from August 14 to August 28, 2025. The recruitment includes ANM (HSC), ANM (RBSK), and ANM (NUHM) posts. Detailed eligibility, age limits, and application fees are specified. The monthly salary is Rs 15,000. Candidates must register with the Bihar Nurses Registration Council to apply. Bihar ANM vacancy 2025: Eligibility, application fee and online application details Bihar ANM recruitment 2025: The State Health Society Bihar (SHS Bihar) has announced a recruitment drive for 5006 Auxiliary Nurse Midwife (ANM) vacancies. Interested and eligible candidates can apply online at the official website shs.bihar.gov.in. The application process opens at 10:00 AM on August 14, 2025, and the last date to submit the application form is 6:00 PM on August 28, 2025.This recruitment drive will fill positions across three categories: 4197 ANM (HSC) posts, 510 ANM (RBSK) posts, and 299 ANM (NUHM) posts. Candidates who meet the eligibility criteria, including educational qualifications and age limits, are encouraged to apply within the stipulated timeline to secure a position.Vacancy details and eligibility criteriaThe total number of vacancies for the SHS Bihar ANM recruitment 2025 stands at 5006. The breakdown is as follows:S. No.ANM categoryNumber of posts1ANM (HSC)4,1972ANM (RBSK)5103ANM (NUHM)299Total5,006Candidates must have completed a two-year full-time ANM training course (diploma) from a recognised institution. Additionally, registration with the Bihar Nurses Registration Council is mandatory. The minimum age to apply is 21 years as of August 1, 2025.The maximum age limits for female candidates are specified by category:• Unreserved/EWS: 40 years• Backward/Extremely Backward Class: 40 years• Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe: 42 yearsAge relaxation will be provided as per government rules.Application fee detailsThe application fee for the SHS Bihar ANM recruitment varies based on category and domicile status:S. No.CategoryApplication fee (Rs)1General/Backward/Extremely Backward Class/EWS5002Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe permanent residents of Bihar1253Reserved/Unreserved female candidates from Bihar1254All candidates from outside Bihar (male/female)5005Divyang candidates with 40% or more disability125How to apply online for SHS Bihar ANM recruitment 2025Candidates can follow these five steps to apply online:Step 1: Visit the official website: shs.bihar.gov.inStep 2: Locate the SHS Bihar ANM recruitment 2025 notification and read it carefully.Step 3: Register on the portal using a valid email ID and mobile number.Step 4: Fill in the online application form with all required personal, educational, and contact details.Step 5: Upload scanned copies of the necessary documents and pay the application fee as per category. Submit the form before the deadline.Candidates are advised to review all details thoroughly before submitting the application to avoid errors.Direct link to download the official Bihar ANM recruitment 2025 notificationClick here to visit the official website Salary and additional informationThe selected candidates for the ANM posts will receive a monthly salary of Rs 15,000. The recruitment notification also provides information about the selection process and document verification, which candidates can find in the official PDF notification released on August 12, 2025, available on the SHS Bihar website.The recruitment drive aims to fill vital healthcare positions across the state, strengthening Bihar’s public health infrastructure through the appointment of qualified Auxiliary Nurse Midwives.All interested candidates should ensure they apply online before 6:00 PM on August 28, 2025, to participate in the recruitment process.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. HP TET June 2025 result released at hpbose.org; download here
HP TET June 2025 result: The Himachal Pradesh Board of School Education (HPBOSE) has declared the HP TET June 2025 results on August 13, 2025. A total of 31,506 candidates appeared for the exams held across five dates in ten subjects. Out of these, 10,880 candidates qualified. The final answer key has also been released. Results are available on the official website, and certificates can be accessed via Digi Locker. Candidates can check their results using their Roll No or Application No.
HP TET June 2025 result released at hpbose.org; download here - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNewsHP TET June 2025 result released at hpbose.org; download hereTrendingUPSC Mains Admit CardH1B VisaHP TET June ResultPunjab Police Constable ResultHPBOSE Supplementary Exam ResultIBPS PO Admit CardUP Police RecruitmentTN TET RecruitmentIndian Navy RecruitmentRRB NTPC Admit CardUPSC Mains Admit CardH1B VisaHP TET June ResultPunjab Police Constable ResultHPBOSE Supplementary Exam ResultIBPS PO Admit CardUP Police RecruitmentTN TET RecruitmentIndian Navy RecruitmentRRB NTPC Admit CardUPSC Mains Admit CardH1B VisaHP TET June ResultPunjab Police Constable ResultHPBOSE Supplementary Exam ResultIBPS PO Admit CardUP Police RecruitmentTN TET RecruitmentIndian Navy RecruitmentRRB NTPC Admit CardHP TET June 2025 result released at hpbose.org; download hereSanjay Sharma / TOI Education / Updated: Aug 13, 2025, 18:18 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeHP TET June 2025 result: The Himachal Pradesh Board of School Education (HPBOSE) has declared the HP TET June 2025 results on August 13, 2025. A total of 31,506 candidates appeared for the exams held across five dates in ten subjects. Out of these, 10,880 candidates qualified. The final answer key has also been released. Results are available on the official website, and certificates can be accessed via Digi Locker. Candidates can check their results using their Roll No or Application No. HPBOSE TET Result for June 2025HP TET June 2025 result declared; download certificate from Digi LockerHPBOSE TET Result for June 2025HP TET June 2025 result declared; download certificate from Digi LockerHPBOSE TET Result for June 202512 HP TET June 2025 result: The Himachal Pradesh Board of School Education (HPBOSE), Dharamshala, has officially declared the results of the Teacher Eligibility Test (HP TET) June 2025 session. The examination was conducted across the state in both morning and evening sessions and covered a total of ten subjects.According to HPBOSE, the final results were released on August 13, 2025, and are now available on the board’s official website, www.hpbose.org. Candidates can check their individual results by entering their ROLL NO or APPLICATION NO through the "TET JUNE-2025 LINK" provided on the homepage.Exams conducted across multiple dates and subjectsThe HP TET June 2025 examinations were held on June 1, June 8, June 11, June 14, and July 12, 2025. Subjects included TGT (Arts), TGT (Medical), TGT (Non-Medical), TGT (Hindi), TGT (Sanskrit), JBT, Punjabi, Urdu, Special Educator TET (For Pre-Primary to Class V), and Special Educator TET (For Class VI to Class XII).A total of 34,599 candidates applied for the examination. Of these, 31,506 candidates appeared, while 3,093 remained absent. No unfair means cases (UMC) were reported. A total of 10,880 candidates were declared passed, and 20,626 candidates did not qualify.Subject-wise statisticsHPBOSE provided a breakdown of the subject-wise performance of candidates as follows:TET SubjectAppliedAppearedAbsentPassedFailedPass %TGT (Arts)12,51911,435108452826,15346.19%TGT (Medical)4,5104,1773337103,46717.00%TGT (Non-Medical)6,7446,32741719114,41630.20%TGT (Hindi)2,4322,2302026561,57429.42%Special Educator (Pre-Primary to Class V)1,03588015538549543.75%Special Educator (Class VI to Class XII)44733311421511864.56%Punjabi1229131147715.38%Urdu13582340.00%JBT57315,11861315443,57430.17%TGT (Sanskrit)104691013616174917.69%Final answer key issued by subject expertsThe final answer key was prepared after subject experts reviewed all objections raised against the provisional answer key. This updated key formed the basis for the final result computation.Certificates available on Digi LockerAll candidates who qualified in the examination can download their certificates via Digi Locker. HPBOSE has enabled this digital mode for convenience. For further queries, candidates may contact the board at 01892-242192.How to check and download the HP TET June 2025 result at hpbose.orgStep 1: Visit the official website: www.hpbose.orgStep 2: Click on TET JUNE-2025 LINK on the homepageStep 3: Enter your ROLL NO or APPLICATION NOStep 4: Click on the Search or Submit buttonStep 5: Download and save your result for future referenceDirect link to check the HP TET June 2025 result | Link 2TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. HPBOSE Class 10th,12th supplementary exam results 2025 expected to release soon: Check where and how to download scorecards, once released
The Himachal Pradesh Board of School Education (HPBOSE) is expected to soon release the Class 10 and 12 supplementary exam results 2025. While the exact date is yet to be announced, students can check their results online at hpbose.org or hpresults.nic.in, and possibly via DigiLocker or SMS. The supplementary exams give students who failed in one or more subjects another chance to pass. Once released, scorecards will display subject-wise marks, total marks, result status, and other details. Students can collect original mark sheets from their schools.
HPBOSE Class 10th,12th supplementary exam results 2025 expected to release soon: Check where and how to download scorecards, once released - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNewsHPBOSE Class 10th,12th supplementary exam results 2025 expected to release soon: Check where and how to download scorecards, once releasedTrendingUPSC Mains Admit CardH1B VisaBihar NEET UG CounsellingPunjab Police Constable ResultICAR AIEEA PGIBPS PO Admit CardUP Police RecruitmentTN TET RecruitmentIndian Navy RecruitmentRRB NTPC Admit CardUPSC Mains Admit CardH1B VisaBihar NEET UG CounsellingPunjab Police Constable ResultICAR AIEEA PGIBPS PO Admit CardUP Police RecruitmentTN TET RecruitmentIndian Navy RecruitmentRRB NTPC Admit CardUPSC Mains Admit CardH1B VisaBihar NEET UG CounsellingPunjab Police Constable ResultICAR AIEEA PGIBPS PO Admit CardUP Police RecruitmentTN TET RecruitmentIndian Navy RecruitmentRRB NTPC Admit CardHPBOSE Class 10th,12th supplementary exam results 2025 expected to release soon: Check where and how to download scorecards, once releasedApeksha Tanwar / TOI Education / Updated: Aug 13, 2025, 14:16 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeThe Himachal Pradesh Board of School Education (HPBOSE) is expected to soon release the Class 10 and 12 supplementary exam results 2025. While the exact date is yet to be announced, students can check their results online at hpbose.org or hpresults.nic.in, and possibly via DigiLocker or SMS. The supplementary exams give students who failed in one or more subjects another chance to pass. Once released, scorecards will display subject-wise marks, total marks, result status, and other details. Students can collect original mark sheets from their schools.  The Himachal Pradesh Board of School Education (HPBOSE) is anticipated to announce the supplementary examination results for Class 10 and Class 12 students soon. Although, the board has not yet announced any official date or time for the release. Candidates who appeared for the compartment exams will be able to access their results online once released by the board. Supplementary examinations are conducted for students who were unable to pass one or more subjects in the regular board examinations, offering them an opportunity to improve their scores and clear the pending subjects. The HP Board Class 10 and Class 12 supplementary results for 2025 will provide a comprehensive view of student performance, including subject-wise marks and overall result status.Where to check HPBOSE 10th and 12th supplementary results 2025 Students can view their results on the official board portals:  hpbose.org   hpresults.nic.in   Additionally, the results may also be accessible through DigiLocker or via SMS notifications. Once available online, candidates can collect their original mark sheets directly from their respective schools.How to download HPBOSE 10th and 12th supplementary results 2025 To check and download the HP Board supplementary scorecards, students can follow these steps:  Visit the official Himachal Pradesh Board of School Education website at hpbose.org   Navigate to the "Results" section on the homepage.   Select the link corresponding to either the Class 10 or Class 12 supplementary result for 2025.   Enter your roll number in the provided login field.   Click on "Search" or "Submit" to access your result.   The marksheet will appear on the screen.   Download and save a copy for future reference.  HPBOSE 10th and 12th supplementary results 2025: Details mentioned The online scorecard is expected to contain the following information:  Student's full name   Roll number   Class and stream (for Class 12 students)   Subject-wise marks   Total marks obtained   Result status (Pass/Fail)   Any remarks, if applicable   Students are advised to keep a copy of the digital marksheet and follow official sources for the most accurate updates regarding the HPBOSE supplementary results.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. Bihar NEET UG 2025 round 1 revised counselling schedule released at bceceboard.bihar.gov.in: Check important dates here
The Bihar Combined Entrance Competitive Examination Board (BCECEB) has released the revised Round 1 counselling schedule for Bihar NEET UG 2025. Fresh registrations and choice filling are open until August 18, 2025, and previous submissions between July 30 and August 8 are nullified. Candidates must complete fresh choice filling to be considered for MBBS, BDS, and BVSc admissions. Complete schedule is on bceceboard.bihar.gov.in.
Bihar NEET UG 2025 round 1 revised counselling schedule released at bceceboard.bihar.gov.in: Check important dates here - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOITOI GamesLive VideosCityMetro CitiesmumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiOther CitiesCityagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesIndiafeaturedOperation SindoorCancel PatriarchyMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesSaving Our StripesDigital ArrestWorldBusinessTechCricketSportsEntertainmentAstroTVEducationLife & StyleWeb SeriesTimes EvokePhotosBlogsToday's ePaperNewsBihar NEET UG 2025 round 1 revised counselling schedule released at bceceboard.bihar.gov.in: Check important dates hereBihar NEET UG 2025 round 1 revised counselling schedule released at bceceboard.bihar.gov.in: Check important dates hereApeksha Tanwar / TOI Education /  Aug 13, 2025, 13:46 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeThe Bihar Combined Entrance Competitive Examination Board (BCECEB) has released the revised Round 1 counselling schedule for Bihar NEET UG 2025. Fresh registrations and choice filling are open until August 18, 2025, and previous submissions between July 30 and August 8 are nullified. Candidates must complete fresh choice filling to be considered for MBBS, BDS, and BVSc admissions. Complete schedule is on bceceboard.bihar.gov.in.  The Bihar Combined Entrance Competitive Examination Board (BCECEB) has released the revised schedule for the Bihar National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET) Undergraduate (UG) counselling 2025 round 1. Candidates can register and complete the application-cum-choice filling process on the official website: bceceboard.bihar.gov.in.Candidates who were unable to register or complete the application and choice filling earlier can now submit their registrations until August 18, 2025. It is important to note that all choices filled between July 30 and August 8, 2025, have been declared null and void.Candidates who have already completed their registration and submitted applications within the stipulated period must undertake fresh choice filling according to the revised schedule. Failure to do so will result in non-allotment of seats during the counselling process.The Bihar NEET UG counselling 2025 had been temporarily paused after the board implemented a health department order requiring 50% of seats in private and medical colleges to follow the same fee structure as government colleges. In response, admissions to private institutions under the Bihar Graduate Medical Admission Counselling (UGMAC) 2025 will now proceed based on 100% of seats and their pre-determined fees, similar to the previous year.Revised Bihar NEET counselling 2025 schedule (Round 1)Candidates should note the revised schedule for Round 1 counselling as follows:EventDateRevised date for fresh online registration and submission of Application-cum-Choice filling of application formAugust 13, 2025Last date for online registration and submission of application form through Debit Card/Credit Card/Net Banking/UPI by registered candidatesAugust 18, 2025Last date of choice filling and lockingAugust 19, 2025Publication of Rank CardAugust 20, 2025Round 1 Provisional Seat Allotment Result publicationAugust 24, 2025Downloading of Allotment Order (Round 1)August 26 to 28, 2025Documents Verification and AdmissionAugust 26 to 28, 2025Alternatively, candidates can click on the link provided here to download the Bihar NEET UG 2025 round 1 revised counselling schedule.Candidates will also have the facility to edit their applications for Bihar NEET UG counselling 2025 after the registration and submission deadline.The UGMAC 2025 counselling process facilitates admissions to Bachelor of Medicine, Bachelor of Surgery (MBBS), Bachelor of Dental Surgery (BDS), and Bachelor of Veterinary Science and Animal Husbandry (BVSc and AH) courses in Bihar. Candidates are advised to regularly check the official BCECEB website for updates and notifications.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. Follow us here.Ready to navigate global policies? TS PGECET counselling 2025 registration deadline extended till this date: Check how to apply online here
The TSCHE has extended the registration deadline for TS PGECET 2025 Phase I counselling to August 18, 2025. This extension allows candidates more time to register for M.Tech, M.Pharm, M.Arch, and PharmD programs. Candidates with valid GATE/GPAT scores will be prioritized, and TS PGECET candidates will be considered for remaining seats.
TS PGECET counselling 2025 registration deadline extended till this date: Check how to apply online here - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNewsTS PGECET counselling 2025 registration deadline extended till this date: Check how to apply online hereTrendingUPSC Mains Admit CardH1B VisaIndian Origin Global CEOPunjab Police Constable ResultICAR AIEEA PGIBPS PO Admit CardUP Police RecruitmentTN TET RecruitmentIndian Navy RecruitmentRRB NTPC Admit CardUPSC Mains Admit CardH1B VisaIndian Origin Global CEOPunjab Police Constable ResultICAR AIEEA PGIBPS PO Admit CardUP Police RecruitmentTN TET RecruitmentIndian Navy RecruitmentRRB NTPC Admit CardUPSC Mains Admit CardH1B VisaIndian Origin Global CEOPunjab Police Constable ResultICAR AIEEA PGIBPS PO Admit CardUP Police RecruitmentTN TET RecruitmentIndian Navy RecruitmentRRB NTPC Admit CardTS PGECET counselling 2025 registration deadline extended till this date: Check how to apply online hereTOI Education /  Aug 13, 2025, 12:53 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeThe TSCHE has extended the registration deadline for TS PGECET 2025 Phase I counselling to August 18, 2025. This extension allows candidates more time to register for M.Tech, M.Pharm, M.Arch, and PharmD programs. Candidates with valid GATE/GPAT scores will be prioritized, and TS PGECET candidates will be considered for remaining seats.  The Telangana State Council of Higher Education (TSCHE) has extended the registration deadline for the TS PGECET 2025 Phase I counselling to August 18, 2025. This extension provides candidates additional time to complete the registration process for admission into M.Tech, M.Pharm, M.Arch, and PharmD programs offered by various institutions in Telangana. The revised schedule also includes updated dates for certificate verification, web options entry, and seat allotment. Candidates are advised to adhere to the new timelines to ensure their participation in the counselling process.Eligibility criteria for TS PGECETCandidates are eligible for the counselling process if they have:Qualified TS PGECET 2025, orA valid GATE/GPAT score from 2023, 2024, or 2025.Please note that seats will be filled primarily based on GATE and GPAT scores; TS PGECET candidates will be considered only for remaining seats.How to register for TS PGECETHere is how candidates can register for the counselling process:Visit the official counselling portal: pgecetadm.tgche.ac.inClick on 'TS PGECET Phase I Counselling Registration'Login using your hall ticket number and PGECET rank or GATE/GPAT scoreFill out the registration form and upload required documentsPay the processing feeSubmit the form and take a printout for future referenceImportant documents requiredParticipating candidates have to submit the following documents for verification process:TS PGECET Rank Card or GATE/GPAT Score CardDegree Certificate and MarksheetsIntermediate (10+2) Certificate and MarksheetsCaste Certificate (if applicable)Special Category Certificates (NCC, CAP, PH, Sports)Income Certificate (if applicable)Aadhar CardPassport-sized PhotographsTOI Education is on WhatsApp now. Follow us here.Ready to navigate global policies? Secure your overseas future. RRB NTPC admit card 2025: Check details mentioned in hall tickets and steps to download at rrb.digialm.com
Railway Recruitment Board has released admit cards for Non-Technical Popular Categories Undergraduate examination. The Computer Based Test will start in early August and continue until early September. Candidates can download admit card from the official website. They must check details on admit card. Candidates need to carry admit card and valid ID proof to the exam center.
RRB NTPC admit card 2025: Check details mentioned in hall tickets and steps to download at rrb.digialm.com - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNewsRRB NTPC admit card 2025: Check details mentioned in hall tickets and steps to download at rrb.digialm.comTrendingUPSC Mains Admit CardH1B VisaIndian Origin Global CEOPunjab Police Constable ResultICAR AIEEA PGIBPS PO Admit CardUP Police RecruitmentTN TET RecruitmentIndian Navy RecruitmentRRB NTPC CBT 1 ResultUPSC Mains Admit CardH1B VisaIndian Origin Global CEOPunjab Police Constable ResultICAR AIEEA PGIBPS PO Admit CardUP Police RecruitmentTN TET RecruitmentIndian Navy RecruitmentRRB NTPC CBT 1 ResultUPSC Mains Admit CardH1B VisaIndian Origin Global CEOPunjab Police Constable ResultICAR AIEEA PGIBPS PO Admit CardUP Police RecruitmentTN TET RecruitmentIndian Navy RecruitmentRRB NTPC CBT 1 ResultRRB NTPC admit card 2025: Check details mentioned in hall tickets and steps to download at rrb.digialm.comTOI Education /  Aug 13, 2025, 11:41 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeRailway Recruitment Board has released admit cards for Non-Technical Popular Categories Undergraduate examination. The Computer Based Test will start in early August and continue until early September. Candidates can download admit card from the official website. They must check details on admit card. Candidates need to carry admit card and valid ID proof to the exam center.  The Railway Recruitment Board (RRB) has started releasing the admit cards for the Non-Technical Popular Categories (NTPC) Undergraduate (UG) examination for 2025. This exam is a crucial step for thousands of candidates aspiring to secure various railway posts across India. The Computer-Based Test (CBT) for RRB NTPC 2025 is being conducted over a period starting from early August and will continue until early September.RRB NTPC admit card releasing in batchesTo manage the large number of candidates, RRB is releasing the admit cards in batches. Candidates are advised to regularly check the official RRB website or their respective regional RRB portals for updates. The admit cards are available only for those candidates whose exam dates have been scheduled, and the releases are done a few days prior to the exam date to ensure smooth coordination.How to download your RRB NTPC admit cardDownloading the admit card is simple and must be done well ahead of your exam date. Follow these steps:Visit the official RRB portal at rrb.digialm.com or your regional RRB website.Look for the link related to "CEN 06/2024 (NTPC-UG)" or the specific notification for the 2025 NTPC exam.Enter your Registration Number (User ID) and Password (usually your Date of Birth in DD-MM-YYYY format).Complete the Captcha verification.Submit the details to access your admit card.Download and print a copy of the admit card. It is recommended to carry a hard copy on the exam day.What to check on the admit cardOnce downloaded, candidates should carefully verify the details mentioned on the admit card, including:Candidate’s name and photographExam date and reporting timeExam center addressImportant instructions regarding the examinationIf there are any discrepancies or errors, candidates should contact the RRB helpline immediately to get them rectified.Important guidelines for candidatesCarry a printed copy of the admit card to the examination center. Without it, entry to the exam hall will not be permitted.Along with the admit card, carry a valid photo ID such as Aadhaar card, PAN card, passport, or any other government-issued identity proof.Reach the exam center well in advance to avoid any last-minute rush or issues.Follow all instructions provided on the admit card and at the exam center.Stay updated on any announcements related to COVID-19 safety protocols, as some guidelines may still be in effect.Ready to navigate global policies? Secure your overseas future. Get expert guidance now!End of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousTaarak Mehta fame Palak Sindhwani’s top 10 gorgeous outfitstvDreamy ethnic looks of Jigyasa Singhtv10 loving AMU students oppose 42% fee hike, demand urgent rollback to protect underprivileged learners
Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) students are protesting a significant fee hike, ranging up to 42%, which they argue will limit access to education for those from weaker economic backgrounds. The protests intensified, with students marching and burning an effigy of the Vice Chancellor. The university cites infrastructure improvements as the reason.
AMU students oppose 42% fee hike, demand urgent rollback to protect underprivileged learners - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOITOI GamesLive VideosCityMetro CitiesmumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiOther CitiesCityagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesIndiafeaturedOperation SindoorCancel PatriarchyMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesSaving Our StripesDigital ArrestWorldBusinessTechCricketSportsEntertainmentAstroTVEducationLife & StyleWeb SeriesTimes EvokePhotosBlogsToday's ePaperNewsAMU students oppose 42% fee hike, demand urgent rollback to protect underprivileged learnersAMU students oppose 42% fee hike, demand urgent rollback to protect underprivileged learnersTOI Education /  Aug 13, 2025, 10:56 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAligarh Muslim University (AMU) students are protesting a significant fee hike, ranging up to 42%, which they argue will limit access to education for those from weaker economic backgrounds. The protests intensified, with students marching and burning an effigy of the Vice Chancellor. The university cites infrastructure improvements as the reason.  Students at Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) have been protesting for five days against a sharp increase in annual fees, which they say will block access to higher education for many, especially those from economically weaker backgrounds. On Tuesday, the protest intensified with students marching to the district collectorate and burning an effigy of Vice Chancellor Naima Khatoon.Fee hike up to 42% sparks outrageThe recent fee hike ranges between 36 to 42 percent for some courses. For instance, the annual fee for the Bachelor of Library Science (B.Lib) course jumped from Rs 16,000 last year to over Rs 22,000 this year. The All India Jammu and Kashmir Students Association (AIJKSA) described the increase as “arbitrary, unjustified and exclusionary,” reported PTI.J&K students association appeals to Union Education MinisterNasir Khehami, AIJKSA’s national convenor, said, “The students have been courageously opposing what they see as an arbitrary, unjustified and exclusionary fee hike of up to 36-42 per cent imposed by the university administration,” as reported by PTI. He added, “For this session, the fee for some courses has increased by around 30-40 per cent. For example, the B.Lib course fee was Rs 16,000 last year and has been raised to over Rs 22,000.”University cites infrastructure improvements as reason for hikeAMU Proctor Wasim Ali confirmed the fee increase ranged from Rs 500 to Rs 1,500 across courses, explaining that the hike was mainly to improve infrastructure and was a collective decision by various committees, reported PTI. However, Khehami emphasised, “this explanation does not lessen the crushing burden on the students, many of whom come from socially backward classes, working-class families and economically weaker sections, and are already struggling to meet their daily expenses, including basic meals,” as reported by PTI.Besides the fee issue, students have been demanding the conduct of students’ union elections, which have not been held for eight years. They also seek the removal of certain senior university officials whom they accuse of mishandling the current crisis, reported PTI.Concerns over police crackdown on campusThe protests saw a police crackdown on Friday during collective prayers at the dharna site. Opposition MPs have expressed concern over the reported use of force, writing to the Vice Chancellor demanding explanations and accountability, according to PTI.The Samyukt Kisan Morcha (SKM), a national coalition of farmer bodies, has extended its support to the AMU students. The SKM plans to highlight student grievances alongside farmer issues at a ‘Virodh Diwas’ protest in Aligarh. The group has also called for an investigation into the police actions on campus, reported PTI.The ongoing protests at AMU highlight the challenges faced by students from underprivileged backgrounds in accessing affordable higher education. As fees rise sharply, many fear losing the opportunity to study at prestigious institutions like AMU.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. Indian Navy recruitment drive 2025: Registration begins for 1,266 Civil Tradesman posts at indiannavy.gov.in, check direct link here
The Indian Navy has opened registration for 1,266 Civilian Tradesman Skilled posts in various technical trades. Eligible candidates (10th pass with ITI or equivalent) can apply online at indiannavy.gov.in until September 2, 2025. Selection includes written and skill tests. Pay scale ranges from ₹19,900 to ₹63,200. This drive strengthens naval technical capabilities with skilled civilian personnel.

Eligible candidates (10th pass with ITI or equivalent) can apply online at indiannavy.gov.in until September 2, 2025. Selection includes written and skill tests. Pay scale ranges from ₹19,900 to ₹63,200. This drive strengthens naval technical capabilities with skilled civilian personnel.  The Indian Navy has announced a major recruitment drive for 1,266 Civilian Tradesman Skilled positions, offering a significant opportunity for skilled workers to join one of the country’s most prestigious defence forces. The vacancies span multiple technical trades, ranging from electrical and electronics to shipbuilding and weapon systems. Eligible candidates, primarily 10th pass with ITI certification or relevant military/industrial training, can now apply online from today, August 13, 2025, with the last date being September 2, 2025. The positions come with a competitive pay scale of ₹19,900 to ₹63,200 per month, plus allowances, and selection will be through a written examination followed by skill tests. The recruitment aims to strengthen India’s naval capabilities with technically proficient civilian personnel.How to apply for Indian Navy recruitment drive 2025Here is how interested and eligible candidates can register online:Visit indiannavy.gov.inGo to the Recruitment section and click on “Civilian Tradesman Skilled 2025” linkRegister and fill in personal, academic, and trade preference detailsUpload scanned photograph, signature, and certificatesSubmit the form and save the confirmation pageDirect link to apply for the Indian Navy recruitment drive 2025 is available here.Indian Navy recruitment drive 2025: Vacancy overview The recruitment covers 1,266 posts distributed across trades such as:  Auxiliary   Civil Works   Electrical   Electronics & Gyro   Heat Engines   Ship Building   Weapon Electronics   These positions will be filled across various naval commands, ensuring technical readiness for diverse maritime operations.Indian Navy recruitment drive 2025: Minimum eligibility requirements Applicants must meet one of the following:  10th Pass with ITI certification in the relevant trade,   Completion of Apprenticeship Training at Naval Yard Apprentice Schools, or   Minimum two years of technical service in the Army, Navy, or Air Force.  Age limit: 18 to 25 years as of September 2, 2025.Age relaxation: Applicable for reserved categories as per government norms.Indian Navy recruitment drive 2025: Selection process The selection process for the Indian Navy’s Civilian Tradesman Skilled recruitment will be conducted in multiple stages to ensure only the most suitable candidates are chosen. It will begin with an initial screening of applications to verify eligibility and credentials. Shortlisted candidates will then appear for a written examination designed to assess their trade-specific knowledge as well as general aptitude. Those who qualify in the written test will be invited to undergo a skill or trade test, which will evaluate their practical proficiency in the chosen field. Finally, candidates who clear these stages will go through document verification and a comprehensive medical examination to confirm their fitness for service in the Navy’s demanding operational environment.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. TN TET recruitment 2025: Notification released, registration underway at trb.tn.gov.in, check direct link to apply here
The Tamil Nadu Teachers Recruitment Board has commenced accepting applications for the TNTET 2025, a crucial exam for aspiring teachers in Tamil Nadu's government and private schools, classes 1-8. The application window is open from August 11 to September 8, 2025. The exam includes two papers assessing child development, teaching methods, language proficiency, and subject knowledge.
TN TET recruitment 2025: Notification released, registration underway at trb.tn.gov.in, check direct link to apply here - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNewsTN TET recruitment 2025: Notification released, registration underway at trb.tn.gov.in, check direct link to apply hereTrendingH1B VisaIndian Origin Global CEOPunjab Police Constable ResultICAR AIEEA PGIBPS PO Admit CardUP Police RecruitmentTNPSC Group 2 RegistrationCOMEDK UGET CounsellingTN TRB Teacher Exam RegistrationRRB NTPC CBT 1 ResultH1B VisaIndian Origin Global CEOPunjab Police Constable ResultICAR AIEEA PGIBPS PO Admit CardUP Police RecruitmentTNPSC Group 2 RegistrationCOMEDK UGET CounsellingTN TRB Teacher Exam RegistrationRRB NTPC CBT 1 ResultH1B VisaIndian Origin Global CEOPunjab Police Constable ResultICAR AIEEA PGIBPS PO Admit CardUP Police RecruitmentTNPSC Group 2 RegistrationCOMEDK UGET CounsellingTN TRB Teacher Exam RegistrationRRB NTPC CBT 1 ResultTN TET recruitment 2025: Notification released, registration underway at trb.tn.gov.in, check direct link to apply hereTOI Education /  Aug 13, 2025, 10:10 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeThe Tamil Nadu Teachers Recruitment Board has commenced accepting applications for the TNTET 2025, a crucial exam for aspiring teachers in Tamil Nadu's government and private schools, classes 1-8. The application window is open from August 11 to September 8, 2025. The exam includes two papers assessing child development, teaching methods, language proficiency, and subject knowledge.  The Tamil Nadu Teachers Recruitment Board (TN TRB) has started the application process for the Tamil Nadu Teacher Eligibility Test (TNTET) 2025. This exam is needed for those who want to become teachers in government and private schools in Tamil Nadu for classes 1 to 8. The application started on August 11, 2025, and will end on September 8, 2025. There are two papers in this test: Paper 1 for teaching classes 1 to 5, and Paper 2 for teaching classes 6 to 8. The test checks your knowledge of child growth, teaching methods, languages, and school subjects.TN TET 2025 eligibility criteriaAge Limit: You must be at least 18 years old on July 1, 2025. There is no maximum age limit, so candidates of all ages can apply if they meet the educational qualifications.Educational Qualifications:For Paper 1 (Classes 1 to 5): Candidates should have completed a Diploma in Elementary Education (D.El.Ed) which is usually a 2-year course after 12th standard, or a Bachelor of Elementary Education (B.El.Ed), which is a 4-year degree course. These qualifications focus on teaching young children and basic education.For Paper 2 (Classes 6 to 8): Candidates should hold a Bachelor’s degree in the subject they want to teach, such as Maths, Science, Social Studies, or Languages, along with a Bachelor of Education (B.Ed) degree. The B.Ed course prepares candidates for teaching older students with deeper subject knowledge.Candidates should carefully check that their educational qualifications match these requirements before applying.Exam pattern for TN TET 2025The TNTET exam is designed to check both your teaching ability and subject knowledge. The test consists of multiple-choice questions (MCQs) and is divided into two papers depending on the class level you want to teach.Paper 1 (For Teaching Classes 1 to 5)Total Questions: 150 MCQsTotal Marks: 150 marks (1 mark per question)Duration: 3 hoursSubjects Covered:Child Development and Pedagogy (30 questions) — understanding how children grow and learn, teaching techniquesLanguage I (30 questions) — Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam, Kannada, or Urdu (choose one regional language)Language II (30 questions) — English language skillsMathematics (30 questions) — basic arithmetic and problem-solvingEnvironmental Studies (30 questions) — basic science and social environment knowledgePaper 2 (For Teaching Classes 6 to 8)Total Questions: 150 MCQsTotal Marks: 150 marksDuration: 3 hoursSubjects Covered:Child Development and Pedagogy (30 questions)Language I (30 questions) — regional language options same as Paper 1Language II (30 questions) — EnglishMathematics and Science (60 questions) — deeper knowledge of math and science subjectsSocial Studies (60 questions) — history, geography, civics, and related topicsCandidates must answer all questions within the allotted time. Practicing past papers and focusing on both teaching methodology and subject knowledge will help improve scores.How to apply onlineHere is how interested and eligible candidates will be able to register for TN TET exam:Go to trb.tn.gov.in to find the TNTET 2025 application link.Use a valid email address and mobile number to create your account on the portal.Enter your personal details, educational qualifications, and other required information carefully.Upload scanned copies of your passport-sized photograph and signature as per the specifications mentioned in the notification.Complete the payment of the application fee online using the available payment options.Review all details and submit your form.Download and print the application confirmation page or receipt for future reference.Direct link to apply here.Candidates should keep their login details safe to check application status and exam updates.Ready to navigate global policies? Secure your overseas future. UPPRPB UP Police Recruitment 2025: Notification released for over 4,500 SI posts; check exam pattern, syllabus, and how to apply online here
Uttar Pradesh Police Recruitment 2025 invites applications for 4,543 Sub Inspector posts. Candidates must complete online registration by September 11, 2025. The exam covers Hindi, General Knowledge, Numerical Ability, and Reasoning with 160 objective questions. Detailed syllabus and exam pattern are available at UPPRPB.gov.in. Early preparation is advised to secure this prestigious role.
UPPRPB UP Police Recruitment 2025: Notification released for over 4,500 SI posts; check exam pattern, syllabus, and how to apply online here - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNewsUPPRPB UP Police Recruitment 2025: Notification released for over 4,500 SI posts; check exam pattern, syllabus, and how to apply online hereTrendingH1B VisaIndian Origin Global CEONEET PG ResultICMAI CMA Toppers 2025SSC GD Constable Admit CardRRB Paramedical Staff ResultTNPSC Group 2 RegistrationCOMEDK UGET CounsellingTN TRB Teacher Exam RegistrationRRB NTPC CBT 1 ResultH1B VisaIndian Origin Global CEONEET PG ResultICMAI CMA Toppers 2025SSC GD Constable Admit CardRRB Paramedical Staff ResultTNPSC Group 2 RegistrationCOMEDK UGET CounsellingTN TRB Teacher Exam RegistrationRRB NTPC CBT 1 ResultH1B VisaIndian Origin Global CEONEET PG ResultICMAI CMA Toppers 2025SSC GD Constable Admit CardRRB Paramedical Staff ResultTNPSC Group 2 RegistrationCOMEDK UGET CounsellingTN TRB Teacher Exam RegistrationRRB NTPC CBT 1 ResultUPPRPB UP Police Recruitment 2025: Notification released for over 4,500 SI posts; check exam pattern, syllabus, and how to apply online hereApeksha Tanwar / TOI Education / Updated: Aug 13, 2025, 09:49 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeUttar Pradesh Police Recruitment 2025 invites applications for 4,543 Sub Inspector posts. Candidates must complete online registration by September 11, 2025. The exam covers Hindi, General Knowledge, Numerical Ability, and Reasoning with 160 objective questions. Detailed syllabus and exam pattern are available at UPPRPB.gov.in. Early preparation is advised to secure this prestigious role.  Uttar Pradesh Police has officially released a notification announcing 4,543 vacancies for the positions of Sub Inspector (Civil Police), Sub Inspector (Civil Police – Women) (PC), and Sub Inspector/Platoon Commander (Special Security Force). Aspiring candidates preparing for the Uttar Pradesh Police Sub Inspector Examination 2025 are advised to meticulously review the exam syllabus, examination pattern, and exam schedule to ensure targeted and effective preparation.Eligible candidates can apply online through the official portal at UPPRPB.gov.in.How to apply for UPPRPB UP Police Recruitment 2025Follow the detailed steps below to complete your online application.Visit the official website UPPRPB.gov.in.Click on the “UP Police SI Recruitment 2025” link on the homepage.Complete the new registration process by providing all mandatory details.Login to the candidate portal and accurately fill out the application form.Upload scanned copies of required documents.Pay the application fee through the available online payment methods.Submit the application form and retain a printed copy for future reference.Note: Applicants must first complete the One Time Registration (OTR) process to be eligible for submission. The application procedure is entirely online, and no submissions will be entertained after the closing date. Read Also:UPPRPB UP Police Recruitment 2025: Short notification released for 4,543 SI posts, direct link to complete mandatory OTR hereUPPRPB UP Police Recruitment 2025: Key datesInterested candidates should note the key deadlines to avoid missing any critical steps in the recruitment process.Online application start date: August 12, 2025Online application deadline: September 11, 2025Last date for fee payment: September 11, 2025Exam date: To be announcedAdmit card availability: Prior to examinationResult declaration: Will be updated on the official websiteUPPRPB UP Police Recruitment 2025: Application fee structureCandidates must pay the application fee within the stipulated time to successfully complete their application process.General, Economically Weaker Section (EWS), Other Backward Classes (OBC): ₹500Scheduled Castes (SC), Scheduled Tribes (ST): ₹400Payment can be made securely through multiple online modes including debit card, credit card, internet banking, IMPS, and mobile wallets.UPPRPB UP Police Recruitment 2025: Exam pattern The examination will consist of 160 objective-type questions distributed equally among four subjects, totaling 400 marks. Candidates will be allotted two hours to complete the test.SubjectNumber of questionsMaximum marksDurationGeneral Hindi401002 HoursCurrent Affairs, Basic Law, Constitution, General Knowledge40100Numerical and Mental Ability Test40100Mental Aptitude / IQ / Reasoning Ability40100Total1604002 HoursEditUPPRPB UP Police Recruitment 2025: Syllabus overviewGeneral Hindi: Includes grammar, vocabulary, comprehension, phrase construction, idioms and proverbs, spelling, sentence correction, famous literary works, and language awards.General Knowledge: Covers geography of India and neighbouring countries, scientific developments, national and international awards, languages, capitals, sports, law and constitution fundamentals, human rights, traffic regulations, environmental laws, and legal provisions related to women, children, and Scheduled Castes/Scheduled Tribes.Numerical Ability: Focuses on number systems, simplification, HCF & LCM, interest calculations, partnerships, profit and loss, ratio and proportion, percentages, mensuration, and data interpretation.Mental Ability & Reasoning: Includes logical diagrams, symbol relationships, coding-decoding, series completion, analogy, direction sense, blood relations, Venn diagrams, analytical problem-solving, and decision-making skills.Interested candidates can check the detailed notification PDF available here. The Uttar Pradesh Police Sub Inspector Recruitment 2025 presents a significant career opportunity for young aspirants seeking to serve in one of India’s largest state police forces. Aspirants are strongly encouraged to begin their preparation early, focusing on the detailed syllabus and exam pattern to maximise their chances of success. Candidates must regularly verify details on the official Uttar Pradesh Police Recruitment and Promotion Board website: UPPRPB.gov.inReady to navigate global policies? Secure your overseas future. IBPS PO admit card 2025 for prelims expected soon: Check where and how to download hall ticket, once released
Get ready for the IBPS PO Preliminary Exam. The admit card will be available soon on ibps.in. Exam dates are August 17, 23, and 24, 2025. Download it using your registration details. The hall ticket contains crucial exam details. Carry it with a valid photo ID. Pre-Exam Training admit cards are already out.
IBPS PO admit card 2025 for prelims expected soon: Check where and how to download hall ticket, once released - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNewsIBPS PO admit card 2025 for prelims expected soon: Check where and how to download hall ticket, once releasedTrendingH1B VisaIndian Origin Global CEONEET PG ResultICMAI CMA Toppers 2025SSC GD Constable Admit CardRRB Paramedical Staff ResultTNPSC Group 2 RegistrationCOMEDK UGET CounsellingTN TRB Teacher Exam RegistrationRRB NTPC CBT 1 ResultH1B VisaIndian Origin Global CEONEET PG ResultICMAI CMA Toppers 2025SSC GD Constable Admit CardRRB Paramedical Staff ResultTNPSC Group 2 RegistrationCOMEDK UGET CounsellingTN TRB Teacher Exam RegistrationRRB NTPC CBT 1 ResultH1B VisaIndian Origin Global CEONEET PG ResultICMAI CMA Toppers 2025SSC GD Constable Admit CardRRB Paramedical Staff ResultTNPSC Group 2 RegistrationCOMEDK UGET CounsellingTN TRB Teacher Exam RegistrationRRB NTPC CBT 1 ResultIBPS PO admit card 2025 for prelims expected soon: Check where and how to download hall ticket, once releasedTOI Education /  Aug 13, 2025, 09:12 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeGet ready for the IBPS PO Preliminary Exam. The admit card will be available soon on ibps.in. Exam dates are August 17, 23, and 24, 2025. Download it using your registration details. The hall ticket contains crucial exam details. Carry it with a valid photo ID. Pre-Exam Training admit cards are already out.  The IBPS PO Preliminary Exam admit card 2025 is expected to be released soon on the official website ibps.in. The prelims exam dates are August 17, 23, and 24, 2025. Candidates need to download the admit card using their registration number and password or date of birth. The admit card contains exam details such as date, time, and exam center. It is mandatory to carry the admit card and a valid photo ID to the exam center. Pre-Examination Training admit cards for SC/ST/OBC/Minority candidates were released on August 11, 2025. The mains exam is scheduled for October 12, 2025.How to download the IBPS PO prelims admit card?The admit card for IBPS PO preliminary exam is expected to be released any time soon. Here’s how you can download your hall ticket easily, once released:Go to the official website: ibps.in.Find the section called CRP-PO/MT-XV (this is the current recruitment).Click on the link that says IBPS PO Prelims Admit Card 2025.Enter your registration number or roll number and password or date of birth.Submit the details to see your admit card.Download it and take a printout to carry on exam day.What information is on the admit card?After downloading the IBPS PO admit card, registered candidates are advised to cross-check all the details mentioned in it carefully. Your admit card will have:Your name and roll numberDate, time, and shift of the examAddress of the exam centerImportant exam instructionsYour photograph and signatureWhat to carry on exam dayTo ensure smooth entry and avoid any issues at the exam center, candidates must bring:Printed Admit Card: A clear, printed copy of your IBPS PO prelims admit card.Valid Photo Identification: One government-issued ID such as:Aadhaar cardPAN cardPassportPassport-Size Photographs: If specifically mentioned in your admit card instructions, carry recent passport-size photos.Note: Without these documents, candidates will not be permitted to enter the examination hall. Make sure to check the admit card guidelines carefully before the exam day.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. Follow us here.Ready to navigate global policies? Secure your overseas future. ICAR AIEEA PG, AICE JRF/SRF PhD results 2025 out at exams.nta.ac.in/ICAR: Direct link to download scorecards here
The National Testing Agency (NTA) has declared the ICAR AIEEA PG and AICE JRF/SRF Ph.D. results 2025. Held on July 3, the exams saw over 35,000 candidates. Scorecards are available at exams.nta.ac.in/ICAR. AIEEA PG scores aid postgraduate admissions, while AICE Ph.D. scores determine doctoral entries. Candidates can check results online using their application number and date of birth.
ICAR AIEEA PG, AICE JRF/SRF PhD results 2025 out at exams.nta.ac.in/ICAR: Direct link to download scorecards here - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNewsICAR AIEEA PG, AICE JRF/SRF PhD results 2025 out at exams.nta.ac.in/ICAR: Direct link to download scorecards hereTrendingH1B VisaIndian Origin Global CEONEET PG ResultICMAI CMA Toppers 2025SSC GD Constable Admit CardRRB Paramedical Staff ResultTNPSC Group 2 RegistrationCOMEDK UGET CounsellingTN TRB Teacher Exam RegistrationRRB NTPC CBT 1 ResultH1B VisaIndian Origin Global CEONEET PG ResultICMAI CMA Toppers 2025SSC GD Constable Admit CardRRB Paramedical Staff ResultTNPSC Group 2 RegistrationCOMEDK UGET CounsellingTN TRB Teacher Exam RegistrationRRB NTPC CBT 1 ResultH1B VisaIndian Origin Global CEONEET PG ResultICMAI CMA Toppers 2025SSC GD Constable Admit CardRRB Paramedical Staff ResultTNPSC Group 2 RegistrationCOMEDK UGET CounsellingTN TRB Teacher Exam RegistrationRRB NTPC CBT 1 ResultICAR AIEEA PG, AICE JRF/SRF PhD results 2025 out at exams.nta.ac.in/ICAR: Direct link to download scorecards hereApeksha Tanwar / TOI Education /  Aug 13, 2025, 08:49 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeThe National Testing Agency (NTA) has declared the ICAR AIEEA PG and AICE JRF/SRF Ph.D. results 2025. Held on July 3, the exams saw over 35,000 candidates. Scorecards are available at exams.nta.ac.in/ICAR. AIEEA PG scores aid postgraduate admissions, while AICE Ph.D. scores determine doctoral entries. Candidates can check results online using their application number and date of birth.  The National Testing Agency (NTA) has officially announced the results of the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR) – All India Entrance Examination for Admission (AIEEA) Postgraduate (PG) and All India Competitive Examinations (AICE) – Junior Research Fellowship (JRF) / Senior Research Fellowship (SRF) Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) for the academic session 2025–26. Candidates can now access their scorecards on the official examination portal: exams.nta.ac.in/ICAR. The entrance examinations, held on July 3, 2025, were conducted in computer-based mode across 161 centres in 83 cities nationwide. According to NTA, 27,384 candidates registered for AIEEA PG, of which 25,338 appeared. For AICE JRF/SRF (Ph.D.), 11,116 candidates registered and 9,940 appeared. Following the objection window against provisional answer keys, NTA verified challenges and finalised the keys for result processing. In the final evaluation, nine questions from AIEEA PG and seventeen questions from AICE Ph.D. were dropped, and scores were computed accordingly.How to check ICAR AIEEA PG 2025 and AICE PhD 2025 resultCandidates can follow the steps below to access and download their scorecards:  Visit the official website: exams.nta.ac.in/ICAR.   Click on the link for “ICAR AIEEA PG 2025 / AICE Ph.D. 2025 Scorecard.”   Enter your Application Number and Date of Birth.   View your scorecard on the screen.   Download and print the scorecard for future reference.   Direct link to download the ICAR AIEEA PG 2025 and AICE PhD 2025 results is available here. Link 1, Link 2What's next for candidates? The AIEEA PG scores will be used for admissions to postgraduate courses in disciplines such as agriculture, horticulture, forestry, veterinary science, animal sciences, agricultural engineering, community science, fisheries, dairy science, and allied sciences. AICE Ph.D. scores will determine admission to doctoral programmes in corresponding fields.For further queries, candidates may contact the NTA Helpdesk at 011-40759000 or 69227700, or email icar@nta.ac.in.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. Follow us here.Ready to navigate global policies? Secure your overseas future. Get expert guidance now!End of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousDreamy ethnic looks of Jigyasa Singhtv10 loving things to tell a child before bedtimeLifestyleVaani Kapoor
