When Rishi wrote about Raj Kapoor's affair with Vyajanthimala
Vyjayanthimala, a celebrated actress, faced body shaming early in her career despite achieving great success in Indian cinema. Rumors of an affair with Raj Kapoor surfaced, causing turmoil in his family life, even though she denied it. She later married Dr.
When Rishi Kapoor revealed his mom Krishna Kapoor moved out of Raj Kapoor's house when he was having an affair with Vyajanthimala: 'My mother wouldn't give in till.....' | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodWhen Rishi Kapoor revealed his mom Krishna Kapoor moved out of Raj Kapoor's house when he was having an affair with Vyajanthimala: 'My mother wouldn't give in till.....'TrendingKangana RanautJohn AbrahamMrunal ThakurSaurabh SachdevaCoolieNamrata ShirodkarJanhvi KapoorBobby DeolDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionKangana RanautJohn AbrahamMrunal ThakurSaurabh SachdevaCoolieNamrata ShirodkarJanhvi KapoorBobby DeolDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionKangana RanautJohn AbrahamMrunal ThakurSaurabh SachdevaCoolieNamrata ShirodkarJanhvi KapoorBobby DeolDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionWhen Rishi Kapoor revealed his mom Krishna Kapoor moved out of Raj Kapoor's house when he was having an affair with Vyajanthimala: 'My mother wouldn't give in till.....'TOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 13, 2025, 15:55 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeVyjayanthimala, a celebrated actress, faced body shaming early in her career despite achieving great success in Indian cinema. Rumors of an affair with Raj Kapoor surfaced, causing turmoil in his family life, even though she denied it. She later married Dr.  Vyjanthimala was one of the best actresses in Indian cinema, known for her movies like 'Naya Daur', 'Madhumati', 'Sangam' and more. While she achieved a top position among actresses of those times along with others like Waheeda Rehman, Madhubala, her journey wasn't easy. She faced a lot of body shaming and later was also in the news for rumours of her relationship with Raj Kapoor when he was already married to Krishna Kapoor. Her entry into films came at just 16, with the 1949 Tamil hit Vaazhkai. But her road to success wasn’t always smooth — she endured body shaming early in her career. In her memoir Bonding, she recalled how Nagin director Nandlal Jaswantlal would humiliate her in public: “You are too plump and still have a lot of baby fat. You have such a round face, that it fills the whole screen. Don’t look like an idli.” The taunts often left her with “tears shimmering in my eyes, all set to roll down.”Bollywood’s Golden Girls Reunite: Asha Parekh, Waheeda Rehman & Helen Share Heartfelt DinnerVyjayanthimala’s career choices were overseen by her grandmother, Yadugiri Devi, who mistrusted Raj Kapoor’s reputation with women. Even so, gossip linked the two actors, especially after Sangam. Vyjayanthimala denied any affair in her memoir, calling it a publicity stunt: “Manufacturing the romance because of his hunger for publicity.”But Rishi Kapoor’s autobiography Khullam Khulla told a different story. He wrote about moving out of the family home with his mother, Krishna Kapoor, during the alleged affair: “I remember moving into the Natraj Hotel on Marine Drive with my mom during the time papa was involved with Vyjayanthimala. From the hotel, we shifted for two months into an apartment in Chitrakoot. My father had bought the apartment for mom and us. He did all he could to woo her back, but my mother wouldn’t give in until he had ended that chapter of his life.”Vyjayanthimala and Raj Kapoor appeared together in just two films — Nazrana (1961) and Sangam (1964). Then, in 1968, at the height of her stardom, she stunned the industry by marrying the Kapoor family’s doctor, Dr. Chamanlal Bali, and stepping away from films. Dance, however, remained a constant in her life through stage performances. Reflecting on her decision, she wrote, “I made the wisest decision of my life, I left the films at the right time. I have no regrets because I worked with some of the best.”About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. Kireeti Reddy-Sreeleela starrer 'Junior' OTT release details
Kireeti Reddy's debut film 'Junior,' also starring Sreeleela and Genelia Deshmukh, is reportedly heading for an OTT release on Amazon Prime Video on August 15, 2025. The action-drama, which hit theaters in July, earned ₹9.5 crore worldwide. While reviews praised the performances, particularly Sreeleela's energy and Genelia's return, some critics found the storyline predictable.
Junior's OTT release: Find out where and when the Kireeti Reddy-Sreeleela starrer is likely to stream online—Report | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenttelugumoviesJunior's OTT release: Find out where and when the Kireeti Reddy-Sreeleela starrer is likely to stream online—ReportTrendingKangana RanautJohn AbrahamMrunal ThakurSaurabh SachdevaCoolieNamrata ShirodkarJanhvi KapoorBobby DeolDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionKangana RanautJohn AbrahamMrunal ThakurSaurabh SachdevaCoolieNamrata ShirodkarJanhvi KapoorBobby DeolDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionKangana RanautJohn AbrahamMrunal ThakurSaurabh SachdevaCoolieNamrata ShirodkarJanhvi KapoorBobby DeolDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionJunior's OTT release: Find out where and when the Kireeti Reddy-Sreeleela starrer is likely to stream online—ReportTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 13, 2025, 16:26 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeKireeti Reddy's debut film 'Junior,' also starring Sreeleela and Genelia Deshmukh, is reportedly heading for an OTT release on Amazon Prime Video on August 15, 2025. The action-drama, which hit theaters in July, earned ₹9.5 crore worldwide. While reviews praised the performances, particularly Sreeleela's energy and Genelia's return, some critics found the storyline predictable. Picture Credit: X The Telugu action-drama 'Junior,' which marked the big-screen debut of Kireeti Reddy, son of mining baron Gali Janardhana Reddy, seems to be getting a digital release. Directed by Radha Krishna Reddy, the film pairs the newcomer with young star Sreeleela in the female lead role. It also marks the return of Genelia Deshmukh to Telugu cinema after several years.OTT detailsAccording to a report by 123Telugu, 'Junior' is likely to make its OTT debut on Amazon Prime Video on August 15, 2025. While there's no official confirmation yet, it is suggested that the streaming deal is in place, and the film might drop in multiple languages, including Kannada and Telugu, with possible dubs in other Indian languages.‘Sitaare Zameen Par’: Riteish Deshmukh’s Emotional Shoutout For Genelia’s Big WinBox office collectionReleased on Jul 18, 'Junior' managed to net Rs 7.65 crore in India and gross Rs 9.5 crore worldwide, as per data from trade analyst Sacnilk. The film drew decent footfalls from mass audiences, thanks to its action sequences and high-energy dance numbers, but struggled to hold universal appeal due to its predictable storyline.Early Twitter reviewsTwitter reviews at the time of the release suggested mixed opinions. Several viewers praised Kireeti's confidence and dancing skills in the film, calling his debut a fair representation of the debutant in the first half. Nonetheless, some felt that the story wasn't anything new and that its treatment and narrative construction felt outdated.Despite the predictable plot, certain performances stood out. Sreeleela was widely appreciated for bringing her trademark energy and charm to the screen, especially in the first half. Her dance numbers were singled out as major crowd-pullers. Genelia Deshmukh, stepping back into Telugu films after a long hiatus, was also appreciated by fans.The supporting cast included veteran actors like V. Ravi Chandran, Rao Ramesh, Sudharani, Achyut Rao, Satya, and Viva Harsha.The music of the film was composed by Devi Sri Prasad. When Sridevi picked THIS film as her best work
Sridevi, the iconic Bollywood actress, left an indelible mark on Indian cinema with her versatility and captivating performances across multiple languages. While she delivered numerous memorable roles, Sridevi considered 'Mr. India,' directed by Shekhar Kapur, as her finest work.
Not ‘Chandni’ or ‘ChaalBaaz,’ Sridevi picked THIS film as her best work: ‘People started thinking I can act’ | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodNot ‘Chandni’ or ‘ChaalBaaz,’ Sridevi picked THIS film as her best work: ‘People started thinking I can act’TrendingKangana RanautJohn AbrahamMrunal ThakurSaurabh SachdevaCoolieNamrata ShirodkarJanhvi KapoorBobby DeolDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionKangana RanautJohn AbrahamMrunal ThakurSaurabh SachdevaCoolieNamrata ShirodkarJanhvi KapoorBobby DeolDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionKangana RanautJohn AbrahamMrunal ThakurSaurabh SachdevaCoolieNamrata ShirodkarJanhvi KapoorBobby DeolDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionNot ‘Chandni’ or ‘ChaalBaaz,’ Sridevi picked THIS film as her best work: ‘People started thinking I can act’TOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 13, 2025, 15:47 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeSridevi, the iconic Bollywood actress, left an indelible mark on Indian cinema with her versatility and captivating performances across multiple languages. While she delivered numerous memorable roles, Sridevi considered 'Mr. India,' directed by Shekhar Kapur, as her finest work.  Bollywood has always been blessed with talents that left a lasting impression not just on the cinematic landscape but also on the hearts of the audience. And one such talented artist who charmed all with her unmatched screen presence, sheer beauty, and the ability to evolve with time and every genre was Sridevi. Unfortunately, Sridevi is no longer among us, but even today, her work, her words, and her perspective towards life and cinema continue to inspire. Sridevi called THIS movie her best filmOver her illustrious career, Sridevi worked not just in Bollywood, but also in Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam, and Kannada cinema. From ‘Chandni’ to ‘ChaalBaaz,’ ‘Lamhe’ to ‘English Vinglish,’ her every film created a different magical spell, which made everyone fall for her and her craft. For her fans, each of her movies is nothing short of a masterpiece, but for Sridevi, there was one film that was special, which she called her best work.Poonam Dhillon Calls Sridevi ‘Brilliant’, Slams ‘Dumb’ Tag As UnfairAnd that movie is none other than ‘Mr India.’ Speaking about the movie and the director, Shekhar Kapur, in an old interview with Colors Cineplex, Sridevi mentioned, "In every film for an artist, it is the director who plays the biggest role. We were spontaneous, but it was the director who helped. For instance, I have worked with Shekhar Kapur, and I really enjoyed my experience in Mr India. It was my best film, I can say. Because that's the first film that was different from a glamorous role. People started talking, of course, I think she can also act."In the same conversation, she vividly remembered the famous Charlie Chaplin scene, which was originally intended to be a small part of the film. However, after Sridevi got all dressed in her costume and started her performance, Shekhar Kapur was so taken aback by her talent. He turned it into a significant comedic moment, one that continues to delight audiences even many years later.Sridevi birthday special: The actress who will always remain our ‘Chandni’About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Beyond the breaking news, we present a celebration of culture. We explore the intersections of entertainment with society, politics, and everyday life.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousAttractive looks of Srithika Akshay's car gets seized in Jammu for tinted window
Akshay Kumar was recently in Jammu for a store launch, but his visit was marked by a minor hiccup. The SUV that transported him was impounded by traffic officials for violating tint regulations. Authorities emphasized that the rules apply uniformly to all vehicles, regardless of ownership, and the car will be released upon compliance.
Did Akshay Kumar's car really get seized in Jammu for breaching legal restrictions on tinted windows? Here's what exactly happened | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodDid Akshay Kumar's car really get seized in Jammu for breaching legal restrictions on tinted windows? Here's what exactly happenedTrendingKangana RanautJohn AbrahamMrunal ThakurSaurabh SachdevaCoolieNamrata ShirodkarJanhvi KapoorBobby DeolDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionKangana RanautJohn AbrahamMrunal ThakurSaurabh SachdevaCoolieNamrata ShirodkarJanhvi KapoorBobby DeolDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionKangana RanautJohn AbrahamMrunal ThakurSaurabh SachdevaCoolieNamrata ShirodkarJanhvi KapoorBobby DeolDhadak 2 Box Office CollectionSaiyaara Box Office CollectionDid Akshay Kumar's car really get seized in Jammu for breaching legal restrictions on tinted windows? Here's what exactly happenedTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 13, 2025, 18:04 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAkshay Kumar was recently in Jammu for a store launch, but his visit was marked by a minor hiccup. The SUV that transported him was impounded by traffic officials for violating tint regulations. Authorities emphasized that the rules apply uniformly to all vehicles, regardless of ownership, and the car will be released upon compliance.  Akshay Kumar was in Jammu for a store launch on Tuesday. Soon, reports of his car being seized by traffic officials due to illegal tinting of windows surfaced online. However, what actually happened was the SUV, which returned after dropping the actor to the airport in Jammu, was impounded by the officials. According to PTI, an official stated that the car had black tinted glasses, which was a violation of rules.Reportedly, the vehicle, which had been brought in for a public event, was found with black-tinted windows darker than the level permitted under the Motor Vehicles Act.According to authorities, the car was flagged during a routine naka inspection. SSP Traffic Jammu City, Farooq Kaiser, stated, “The law is the same for all. The car was found with tinted glasses beyond the permissible limit during our routine naka. The vehicle has been impounded, and appropriate action will follow.”Akshay Kumar Quit ‘Barsaat’ Over Romantic Involvement with Priyanka Chopra? Truth outTraffic Police officials reiterated that road safety and visibility regulations apply uniformly. They cautioned that vehicles featuring unauthorized alterations or excessive tints could face seizure or fines until brought into compliance.The event organizers confirmed that Akshay Kumar’s scheduled appearance went ahead without disruption. The officials further urged motorists to adhere to legal tint limits, warning that strict checks and penalties would remain in place.Under existing rules, the impounded car can only be released once the illegal tint is removed and any applicable fines are paid by the owner or an authorized representative.On the work front for Akshay, the actor will be seen next in 'Jolly LLB 3' along with Arshad Warsi and Saurabh Shukla. The makers just launched the film's teaser on Tuesday, and it got rave reviews on the internet. People are now looking forward to the hilarious banter between Akshay and Arshad in this third installment of the franchise. The actor was last seen in 'Housefull 5'. About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Beyond the breaking news, we present a celebration of culture. We explore the intersections of entertainment with society, politics, and everyday life.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousWhen looks can be deceptive: 10 Atif mourns father Muhammad Aslam’s passing
Pakistani singer Atif Aslam's father, Muhammad Aslam, passed away at 77 after battling health issues following a heart attack. Atif shared an emotional tribute to his 'Iron Man' on Instagram, prompting condolences from fans and celebrities worldwide. The funeral took place in Lahore, with many remembering Atif's father and legacy.
‘Final goodbye to my Iron Man’; Atif Aslam mourns father Muhammad Aslam’s passing— shares post | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimesTOI GamesLive VideosCityMetro CitiesmumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiOther CitiesCityagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesIndiafeaturedOperation SindoorCancel PatriarchyMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesSaving Our StripesDigital ArrestWorldBusinessTechCricketSportsEntertainmentAstroTVEducationLife & StyleWeb SeriesTimes EvokePhotosBlogsNews‘Final goodbye to my Iron Man’; Atif Aslam mourns father Muhammad Aslam’s passing— shares post‘Final goodbye to my Iron Man’; Atif Aslam mourns father Muhammad Aslam’s passing— shares postTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 13, 2025, 13:17 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargePakistani singer Atif Aslam's father, Muhammad Aslam, passed away at 77 after battling health issues following a heart attack. Atif shared an emotional tribute to his 'Iron Man' on Instagram, prompting condolences from fans and celebrities worldwide. The funeral took place in Lahore, with many remembering Atif's father and legacy.  The music industry and millions of fans were left in mourning on Tuesday, August 13, as Pakistani singing sensation Atif Aslam announced the death of his father, Muhammad Aslam, at the age of 77. Months after surviving a heart attack, the man Atif affectionately called his “Iron Man” passed away following ongoing health struggles.'A final good bye to my Iron Man'In an emotional Instagram post, Atif shared a tender photograph with his father and wrote, “A final good bye to my Iron Man. Rest in love Abu g.” Although his social media remains inaccessible in India, screenshots of the tribute quickly spread online, touching fans across borders. The final rites are set to take place in Valencia Town, Lahore, after Asr prayers.Check out the post here.An outpouring of supportThe news sparked a wave of condolences from celebrities, fellow musicians, and fans worldwide. Punjab Chief Minister Maryam Nawaz Sharif extended her sympathies, praying for the family’s strength during this time. One fan tweeted, "Life is so unpredictable. Yesterday we watched Atif Aslam light up the stage, and today we hear the heartbreaking news of his father’s passing. Behind the music, behind the applause, performers carry silent battles we never see. May Allah grant his father the highest place in Jannah and give Atif Aslam & family strength in this difficult time."A legacy beyond bordersAtif Aslam, adored in both Pakistan and India, is known for delivering timeless songs such as 'Tera Hone Laga Hoon,' 'Jeene Laga Hoon,' and 'Pehli Nazar Mein.', and many more as we all know and cherish. Born in Wazirabad, he began his journey with the breakout album Jal Pari before stepping into Bollywood in 2005 with “Adaat.” Meanwhile, he has been active with several notable projects in recent years including 'Ya Nabi Salam Alaika', 'Tumhari Chup' which was featured in the drama series Gentleman, starring Humayun Saeed and Yumna Zaidi.Pakistani singer Atif Aslam and his wife get blessed with a baby girl: 'The new queen of my heart has arrived'About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Beyond the breaking news, we present a celebration of culture. We explore the intersections of entertainment with society, politics, and everyday life.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousMost affordable diesel cars under Rs New study warns! Routine AI use may affect doctors’ tumor diagnostic skills by 20%
Artificial Intelligence is changing healthcare. It helps in early disease detection and treatment. A recent study shows doctors may lose skills if they depend too much on AI. When AI support was removed, doctors' tumor detection skills dropped. Experts suggest using AI as a support tool, not a replacement. Regular training and critical thinking are important to maintain skills.
New study warns! Routine AI use may affect doctors’ tumor diagnostic skills by 20% | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior Carehealth newsfitnessdietmental healthcoronavirusalternative therapiesweight lossvideosdiseasesyogaNewslifestylehealth-fitnesshealth-newsNew study warns! Routine AI use may affect doctors’ tumor diagnostic skills by 20%TOI Lifestyle Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 13, 2025, 19:00 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeArtificial Intelligence is changing healthcare. It helps in early disease detection and treatment. A recent study shows doctors may lose skills if they depend too much on AI. When AI support was removed, doctors' tumor detection skills dropped. Experts suggest using AI as a support tool, not a replacement. Regular training and critical thinking are important to maintain skills.   Artificial Intelligence (AI) is transforming healthcare, offering tools that improve early disease detection, diagnostic accuracy, and treatment planning. AI-assisted systems can help clinicians identify conditions such as pre-cancerous growths or subtle anomalies that might be missed otherwise, boosting patient outcomes and overall clinical efficiency. However, recent research highlights a potential downside: excessive reliance on AI may lead to skill erosion among healthcare professionals. Even experienced doctors who regularly use AI tools may find their independent decision-making and observational abilities decline over time. AI has the potential to transform medicine, improve patient outcomes, and streamline healthcare workflows. However, the recent study serves as a reminder that over-reliance on technology can erode critical skills, even among experienced doctors. A balanced approach—where AI supports rather than replaces human judgment—is essential for sustaining both high-quality patient care and professional expertise.Doctors’ ability to spot pre-cancerous growths declines when AI is removedA recent study in The Lancet Gastroenterology and Hepatology, investigated how AI impacts colonoscopy performance. The researchers found that AI assistance enabled doctors to detect pre-cancerous growths in the colon more effectively, potentially preventing progression to colorectal cancer.However, a concerning trend emerged: when AI support was removed, doctors’ ability to detect tumors dropped by approximately 20%, even compared with rates recorded before AI introduction. This suggests that clinicians may unconsciously rely on AI cues, reducing their independent observational skills.Global adoption of AI in healthcare systemsHealthcare systems worldwide are increasingly investing in AI technology. AI is being positioned as a tool to boost diagnostic accuracy, improve workflow efficiency, and enhance patient safety.For instance, in 2025, the British government announced £11 million (S$19 million) in funding for a trial exploring how AI can facilitate earlier breast cancer detection. While AI offers promising benefits, these developments highlight the importance of maintaining human expertise alongside technological advancements.Doctors losing skills due to AI dependence: Here’s what the study foundThe study revealed that AI can inadvertently encourage over-reliance, even among highly skilled clinicians. According to the research paper, AI support can result in doctors becoming less motivated, less focused, and less responsible when making decisions independently.The researchers studied four endoscopy centers in Poland, comparing colonoscopy detection rates three months before and after AI implementation. The procedures were randomized: some were performed with AI guidance, others without. The difference in detection rates highlighted the risk of skill erosion caused by dependency on AI tools.AI can reduce tumor detection skills in expert doctorsInterestingly, the study participants were 19 highly experienced doctors, each with over 2,000 colonoscopies completed. Despite their expertise, AI still affected their ability to detect tumors without assistance.Professor Yuichi Mori, one of the study authors from the University of Oslo, warned that skill degradation could worsen as AI becomes more sophisticated.Dr. Omer Ahmad, a gastroenterologist at University College Hospital London, added:“Although AI continues to offer great promise to enhance clinical outcomes, we must also safeguard against the quiet erosion of fundamental skills required for high-quality endoscopy.”He noted that the effect could be more pronounced for trainees or novice doctors, who might become overly dependent on AI before mastering essential diagnostic skills.Excessive AI use may reduce brain engagement and focus; study revealsConcerns about over-reliance on AI extend beyond healthcare. A 2025 MIT study found that students using OpenAI’s ChatGPT to write essays demonstrated less cognitive engagement and brain activity, illustrating how AI can unintentionally reduce critical thinking skills.These findings underscore the need for balanced AI integration—leveraging AI’s advantages while ensuring that human expertise and cognitive abilities remain intact.Strategies to maintain skills while using AITo mitigate skill erosion, healthcare professionals and institutions can adopt several strategies:AI as a support tool, not a replacement – Use AI to assist decisions while maintaining independent judgment.Regular performance monitoring – Track detection accuracy with and without AI to identify skill gaps.Structured training rotations – Alternate between AI-assisted and manual procedures to preserve proficiency.Active critical thinking – Encourage clinicians to question and evaluate AI suggestions rather than blindly following them.Continuous education – Reinforce fundamental diagnostic skills through workshops and refresher courses.By implementing these measures, healthcare systems can maximise AI’s benefits while safeguarding essential clinical competencies.Disclaimer: The information presented in this article is for educational and informational purposes only and is not intended as medical advice. Enhance skin glow naturally: Nutritionist reveals an easy homemade antioxidant juice, benefits, and tips for glowing skin
Nutritionist Anjali Mukerjee suggests a homemade juice rich in antioxidants to combat skin ageing. This juice, packed with amla, beetroot, black grapes, and pomegranate, fights free radicals, boosts collagen, and enhances skin elasticity. Regular consumption, along with a balanced lifestyle, can slow visible signs of ageing and promote youthful skin.
Enhance skin glow naturally: Nutritionist reveals an easy homemade antioxidant juice, benefits, and tips for glowing skin | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipbeautyHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior CareNewslifestylebeautyEnhance skin glow naturally: Nutritionist reveals an easy homemade antioxidant juice, benefits, and tips for glowing skinTrendingIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesEnhance skin glow naturally: Nutritionist reveals an easy homemade antioxidant juice, benefits, and tips for glowing skinTOI Lifestyle Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 13, 2025, 17:46 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeNutritionist Anjali Mukerjee suggests a homemade juice rich in antioxidants to combat skin ageing. This juice, packed with amla, beetroot, black grapes, and pomegranate, fights free radicals, boosts collagen, and enhances skin elasticity. Regular consumption, along with a balanced lifestyle, can slow visible signs of ageing and promote youthful skin.  Ever wish you could slow down ageing and maintain radiant, youthful skin? Nutritionist Anjali Mukerjee highlights that glowing skin isn’t just about creams or treatments—it starts with your diet. She recommends a simple, homemade juice packed with antioxidants, vitamins, and essential nutrients that help combat fine lines, dullness, and sagging. By nourishing your body from the inside, this juice supports skin regeneration, improves elasticity, and fights oxidative stress caused by free radicals. Regular consumption can enhance hydration, brighten complexion, and slow visible signs of ageing. Integrating such nutrient-rich beverages into your daily routine offers a natural, affordable, and effective approach to long-term skin health.How diet and antioxidants can slow visible signs of ageing with these powerful superfoodsAgeing is a natural process, but the speed at which your body shows signs of ageing—such as wrinkles, dark spots, and loss of skin elasticity—can be influenced by diet. Foods rich in antioxidants help combat oxidative stress and protect skin cells, potentially delaying visible signs of ageing.Nutritionist Anjali Mukerjee highlights that incorporating antioxidant-rich ingredients like amla (Indian gooseberry), pomegranate, and black grapes into your diet can strengthen the skin’s natural defense system and enhance collagen production, essential for firm, youthful skin.https://www.instagram.com/p/DNKcRRTxtEL/ Why amla, beetroot, and grapes are anti-aging powerhousesBeetroot: Boost circulation and detoxifyBeetroot is packed with vitamin C, iron, and nitrates, which improve blood circulation, enhance skin elasticity, and aid the body’s detoxification process. Improved blood flow ensures that nutrients reach skin cells efficiently, giving the skin an inner glow and youthful vitality.Amla: Collagen booster and free radical fighterAmla is a staple in traditional Indian health practices, revered for its high vitamin C content and potent antioxidant properties. It helps in collagen synthesis, reduces oxidative stress, and supports cellular repair. Together, these benefits slow down the appearance of fine lines, sagging, and pigmentation.Black grapes and pomegranate: Skin-protective nutrientsBlack grapes and pomegranate are rich in polyphenols and antioxidants, which work synergistically with amla and beetroot to neutralize free radicals, prevent cellular damage, and promote skin hydration and elasticity.Homemade anti-ageing juice recipeIngredients:1 small amla (Indian gooseberry)1 cup pomegranate seeds1 cup black grapesBlack salt and chat masala to tastePreparation steps:Grate the deseeded amla and strain it to extract juice.Juice the black grapes and pomegranate separately.Mix all the juices together.Add a pinch of black salt and chat masala for taste.Serve immediately for maximum freshness and potency.Pro tip: Consume this juice within 20 minutes of preparation to retain its antioxidant properties.How this juice fights skin ageingFree radicals are unstable molecules that can damage skin cells, accelerating ageing symptoms like fine lines, pigmentation, and sagging. They are produced naturally through metabolism, environmental exposure, and UV radiation.Antioxidants found in amla, beetroot, pomegranate, and black grapes neutralize free radicals, protect cellular structures, and nourish the skin from the inside out. Regular consumption, combined with a healthy diet, exercise, and proper sleep, can significantly slow down visible ageing while improving overall well-being.Additional tips for healthy, youthful skinStay hydrated: Drink plenty of water to maintain skin elasticity.Balanced diet: Include whole grains, nuts, seeds, and leafy greens for nutrients that support skin health.Regular exercise: Improves circulation, which boosts nutrient delivery to skin cells.Adequate sleep: Allows cellular repair and rejuvenation, essential for youthful skin.About the AuthorTOI Lifestyle DeskThe TOI Lifestyle Desk is a dynamic team of dedicated journalists who, with unwavering passion and commitment, sift through the pulse of the nation to curate a vibrant tapestry of lifestyle news for The Times of India readers. Is it a migraine or a headache? Understanding the key differences
Migraines, often mistaken for common headaches, are neurological disorders distinguished by intense pain and symptoms like nausea and light sensitivity. Tension, sinus, and cluster headaches each have unique characteristics and triggers. Seeking medical advice is crucial for severe or worsening headaches, enabling accurate diagnosis and tailored treatment plans, alongside lifestyle adjustments, to effectively manage these conditions.
Is it a migraine or a headache? Understanding the key differences | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior Carehealth newsfitnessdietmental healthcoronavirusalternative therapiesweight lossvideosdiseasesyogaNewslifestylehealth-fitnesshealth-newsIs it a migraine or a headache? Understanding the key differencesTrendingIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIs it a migraine or a headache? Understanding the key differencesTOI Lifestyle Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 13, 2025, 18:30 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeMigraines, often mistaken for common headaches, are neurological disorders distinguished by intense pain and symptoms like nausea and light sensitivity. Tension, sinus, and cluster headaches each have unique characteristics and triggers. Seeking medical advice is crucial for severe or worsening headaches, enabling accurate diagnosis and tailored treatment plans, alongside lifestyle adjustments, to effectively manage these conditions.  Headaches affect millions worldwide, but not all headaches are the same. Migraines are a unique neurological disorder, often confused with common headaches, leading to misdiagnosis and ineffective treatment. Unlike typical headaches, migraines cause intense, throbbing pain, often accompanied by symptoms like nausea, sensitivity to light and sound, and visual disturbances. Understanding the key differences between migraines and tension or cluster headaches is essential for accurate diagnosis and effective migraine treatment. Recognising migraine symptoms early can significantly improve quality of life and help manage this debilitating condition with proper medical care and lifestyle changes.How to differentiate migraine and headachesWhile migraines and common headaches both involve head pain, they differ significantly in their causes, symptoms, and severity. Decode Your Migraines: Understanding Common Triggers And SolutionsMigraines are a neurological condition characterised by intense, often throbbing pain on one side of the head, accompanied by symptoms like nausea, sensitivity to light and sound, and visual disturbances known as aura. In contrast, typical headaches such as tension headaches usually present as a milder, steady, band-like pressure around the head without these additional symptoms. What is a migraineMigraines are intense, recurring headaches accompanied by additional symptoms beyond just pain. They can last from 4 to 72 hours and are often debilitating.Common characteristics of migraines include:One-sided pain: Typically throbbing or pulsating, often on one side of the head.Aura: Visual disturbances such as flashing lights, zigzag lines, or blind spots that occur before the headache.Sensitivity: Increased sensitivity to light (photophobia), sound (phonophobia), and sometimes smells.Nausea and vomiting: Often accompany the headache phase.Other symptoms: Fatigue, dizziness, and difficulty concentrating.Common triggers include hormonal changes (e.g., menstruation), stress, certain foods and drinks (like caffeine or alcohol), dehydration, and changes in sleep patterns.What is a tension headacheTension headaches are the most common type of headache and are generally less severe than migraines.Key features:Pain description: A steady, dull, tightening or pressing sensation, often described as a "band" around the forehead or the back of the head and neck.Pain intensity: Mild to moderate.Duration: Lasts from 30 minutes to several hours, sometimes even days.Associated symptoms: Usually no nausea or vomiting; sensitivity to light or sound is rare.Triggers often include stress, poor posture, anxiety, fatigue, and muscle strain.Sinus headacheSinus headaches arise from inflammation or infection in the sinuses and often accompany sinusitis.Symptoms include:Pain and pressure: Felt around the forehead, cheeks, and eyes.Other symptoms: Nasal congestion, thick nasal discharge, fever, and fatigue.Sinus headaches are often mistaken for migraines but usually resolve with treatment of the underlying sinus infection.Cluster headacheCluster headaches are relatively rare but extremely painful headaches that occur in cyclical patterns or clusters.Characteristics include:Pain location: Severe, burning or piercing pain around one eye or temple.Duration: Usually last between 15 minutes and 3 hours.Frequency: Can occur multiple times a day during cluster periods.Associated symptoms: Red or watery eye, nasal congestion or runny nose on the affected side, drooping eyelid.Cluster headaches often occur in seasonal patterns and may be triggered by alcohol or strong smells.How to know when to see a doctorSeek medical advice if you experience:A sudden, severe headache unlike any before.Headaches that worsen or become more frequent.Headaches accompanied by neurological symptoms such as vision changes, weakness, difficulty speaking, or confusion.Headaches that interfere significantly with daily activities.Headaches following a head injury.Diagnosis and treatmentDiagnosis usually involves:A detailed medical history and description of symptoms.Physical and neurological examinations.Sometimes imaging tests like MRI or CT scans to rule out other causes.Treatment options vary depending on the headache typeMigraines: Pain relief with over-the-counter medications, triptans, anti-nausea drugs; preventive medications; lifestyle and dietary changes.Tension headaches: Painkillers like paracetamol or ibuprofen, stress reduction techniques, improved posture.Sinus headaches: Treating the underlying infection with decongestants, antihistamines, or antibiotics if necessary.Cluster headaches: Fast-acting treatments like oxygen therapy, triptans, and preventive medications prescribed by specialists.Lifestyle tips to manage headaches and migrainesMaintain a regular sleep schedule.Stay hydrated.Manage stress through relaxation techniques such as meditation or yoga.Avoid known triggers, such as specific foods or environmental factors.Engage in regular physical exercise.Keep a headache diary to identify patterns and triggers.Disclaimer: This article is intended for informational purposes only and does not replace professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment. If you experience severe, persistent, or worsening headaches or migraines, or if your symptoms are accompanied by neurological changes please consult a qualified healthcare professional promptly. How gout increases your risk of developing type 2 diabetes: Know the link between the two
Gout and type 2 diabetes often coexist, exacerbating metabolic health issues through shared risk factors like obesity and poor diet. Insulin resistance links these conditions, impacting glucose metabolism and uric acid excretion. Managing both effectively requires lifestyle adjustments, including diet, exercise, hydration, and smart medication choices to mitigate long-term cardiovascular and kidney risks.
How gout increases your risk of developing type 2 diabetes: Know the link between the two | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior Carehealth newsfitnessdietmental healthcoronavirusalternative therapiesweight lossvideosdiseasesyogaNewslifestylehealth-fitnesshealth-newsHow gout increases your risk of developing type 2 diabetes: Know the link between the twoTrendingIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesHow gout increases your risk of developing type 2 diabetes: Know the link between the twoTOI Lifestyle Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 13, 2025, 17:30 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeGout and type 2 diabetes often coexist, exacerbating metabolic health issues through shared risk factors like obesity and poor diet. Insulin resistance links these conditions, impacting glucose metabolism and uric acid excretion. Managing both effectively requires lifestyle adjustments, including diet, exercise, hydration, and smart medication choices to mitigate long-term cardiovascular and kidney risks.  Gout and type 2 diabetes frequently occur together, creating a cycle that can significantly harm metabolic health. Gout results from the buildup of uric acid crystals in the joints, causing severe inflammation and pain. Type 2 diabetes is characterised by insulin resistance and elevated blood sugar levels. Both conditions share common risk factors, including excess body weight, diets high in sugar and processed foods, and a lack of physical activity. Understanding the connection between gout and diabetes is crucial for effective management, helping to prevent complications and improve overall health and quality of life.Understanding gout and diabetesGoutGout occurs when excess uric acid in the blood forms sharp crystals in the joints. This can trigger intense inflammation, causing severe pain and discomfort. Uric acid is a waste product generated from the breakdown of purines, substances found naturally in the body and certain foods. When the body produces too much uric acid or cannot eliminate it efficiently through the kidneys, levels build up, leading to gout. DiabetesDiabetes is a chronic condition that affects how your body processes blood sugar (glucose), which is a vital energy source. In type 2 diabetes, the most common form, the body becomes resistant to insulin, a hormone that regulates blood sugar levels. Over time, this leads to elevated glucose in the blood, which can cause damage to organs, nerves, and blood vessels. The link between gout and type 2 diabetesExtensive studies show that individuals diagnosed with gout face a substantially higher likelihood of developing type 2 diabetes than those without. The persistent inflammation and elevated uric acid levels in gout contribute to metabolic disturbances that impair insulin sensitivity. Over time, chronic inflammation can interfere with glucose metabolism, making blood sugar control more difficult. This impact is particularly pronounced in women, who often show a stronger correlation between gout and future diabetes. By understanding this risk, healthcare providers can prioritise early monitoring and preventive strategies.How insulin resistance connects diabetes with goutA key link between gout and diabetes lies in insulin resistance. Uric acid appears to disrupt insulin signalling, reducing the body’s ability to use glucose effectively and paving the way for elevated blood sugar. Concurrently, insulin resistance impairs uric acid excretion by the kidneys, elevating uric acid levels and promoting gout attacks. Both conditions also involve overlapping genetic predispositions, genes that influence fat metabolism, inflammation, and the handling of uric acid and glucose often overlap, creating a biological bridge between the two disorders.When diabetes might lower your gout riskInterestingly, the relationship isn’t completely one-way. Certain forms of diabetes, particularly less-managed type 1 diabetes in men, seem to be linked with a lower incidence of gout. One theory suggests that high blood sugar levels may suppress inflammatory responses, thereby reducing the risk of gout flares. That said, this potential protective effect must be balanced against the long-term complications of poorly controlled diabetes, such as cardiovascular and kidney damage.Managing gout and diabetes effectivelyA unified strategy can help manage both gout and diabetes simultaneously, here’s how:1. Maintain a healthy weight and stay activeExcess body weight promotes both insulin resistance and uric acid build-up. Regular moderate exercise, such as brisk walking, swimming, or cycling, helps improve insulin sensitivity and aids in maintaining healthy uric acid levels through daily sweating.2. Embrace a balanced, low‑purine dietFocus on whole foods rich in fibre, lean protein, and low-glycaemic starches. Limit intake of purine-heavy foods like red meat, shellfish, and sugary beverages, which can trigger gout attacks and destabilise blood sugar. 3. Prioritise hydrationAdequate hydration supports kidney function and uric acid elimination. Drinking water throughout the day helps dilute serum uric acid and may prevent crystal formation in joints.4. Smart medication choicesSome medications used to manage diabetes offer additional benefits by promoting uric acid excretion. When prescribing for patients with both gout and diabetes, physicians may also consider adjusting uric acid-lowering therapies like allopurinol or febuxostat alongside blood glucose management drugs.Why this mattersBoth gout and diabetes significantly raise the risk of developing cardiovascular and kidney disease. Having both conditions amplifies that danger. By understanding how they interact and tackling both through lifestyle changes, informed medication use, and regular monitoring, patients and clinicians can greatly reduce long-term complications and improve quality of life.Disclaimer: This information is provided for educational purposes only and is not intended to replace professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Always consult a qualified healthcare provider for personalised advice regarding gout, diabetes, or any other medical condition. 87-year-old Sheila Isaacs reveals her one true love for staying healthy
Sheila Isaacs’ story is a reminder that movement is not just about physical benefits; it’s a way to keep the spirit alive. Whether it’s pedalling down a country lane or cycling by an open garage door, the joy of the ride can be the best medicine of all.
Her longevity secret? 87-year-old Sheila Isaacs reveals her one true love for staying healthy Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior Carehealth newsfitnessdietmental healthcoronavirusalternative therapiesweight lossvideosdiseasesyogaNewslifestylehealth-fitnesshealth-newsHer longevity secret? 87-year-old Sheila Isaacs reveals her one true love for staying healthyTrendingIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesHer longevity secret? 87-year-old Sheila Isaacs reveals her one true love for staying healthyTOI Lifestyle Desk / ETimes.in /  Aug 13, 2025, 18:00 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollow us 1/6What Sheila's love teaches us about longevityFor many, retirement means slowing down. For Sheila Isaacs, it meant gearing up, literally. Now 87, Sheila has been competing in triathlons for over 35 years, and the one activity that has stolen her heart is cycling. It’s more than just exercise for her, it’s joy, freedom, and the key to staying strong well into her 80s.In a recent interview with Women’s Health, Sheila shared how her love for cycling has evolved over the years and why it continues to keep her fit. But what exactly makes cycling such a powerful tool for healthy ageing? 2/6Cycling through the yearsSheila’s relationship with cycling has changed with age. In her 80s, tall racing bikes became harder to mount, so she switched to a shorter stationary bike indoors, still positioned by the open garage door to soak in fresh air and outdoor views.Modifying workouts with age isn’t quitting, it’s smart training. As joints become more sensitive, high-impact activities like running can strain knees and hips. Switching to a low-impact activity like cycling helps maintain cardiovascular health without overloading the joints. It’s a practical example of the saying: “Train smarter, not harder.”3/6Why cycling keeps the body youngerCycling isn’t just a leg workout. It engages the core, improves balance, and boosts cardiovascular endurance. Sheila alternates cycling days with swimming and weightlifting, which keeps her muscles challenged and prevents overuse injuries.According to studies, regular cycling helps maintain bone density, muscle mass, and coordination, all of which naturally decline with age. The steady pedalling motion also promotes better blood circulation, which supports brain function and lowers the risk of age-related cognitive decline.4/6The science of fun and longevitySheila admits that her biggest shift came when she stopped stressing over races and simply started enjoying them. To her, race day is “a swim, a bike ride, and a walk.” That mindset has kept her going for decades.​Researchers have found that people who exercise for enjoyment, not obligation, are far more likely to stick to it long-term. Fun releases dopamine and endorphins, the “happy hormones” that not only lift mood but also reduce inflammation, one of the key factors in age-related diseases.5/6Tracking progress without obsessionSheila has been logging her workouts for 30 years, time, distance, mileage, and even how she feels. This habit helps her adjust training when her joints feel sore and ensures she never pushes beyond healthy limits.Fitness tracking isn’t about chasing numbers; it’s about listening to the body. Studies show that self-monitoring increases awareness of physical limits, which lowers the risk of injury and improves long-term adherence to exercise. It’s the difference between exercising for a few years and exercising for a lifetime.6/6The lesson in Sheila’s pedal powerSheila’s cycling story isn’t just about stamina; it’s about adaptability, joy, and community. At her 200th triathlon, she raced alongside her daughter and granddaughter. Her goal? Not winning, but finishing healthy and happy.This outlook aligns with what longevity experts often say: social connections and meaningful activities are as vital as physical fitness for a long, healthy life. Cycling has given Sheila both a reason to move and a circle of fellow athletes to share it with.[Disclaimer: This article is based on Sheila Isaacs’ personal experience as shared with Women’s Health. Cycling has many proven health benefits, but exercise routines should be tailored to individual needs and medical conditions. Always seek professional advice before starting or modifying any fitness program.]Follow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousSet up a mini lotus pond at home with these easy tipsindiaJanmashtami 2025: How to make Makhana Paag at home forChhappan BhogFoodAttractive looks of Srithika SaneeshindiaSheet masks out, Kareena Kapoor Khan’s DIY napkin mask inindia10 creatures that can walk on waterindia​Bhagyashri Borse charms with her gorgeous outfits​indiaThese Zodiac Signs Play the Victim When They’re Actually in Controlindia10 things to know before getting a pet rabbitindiaThe Great Indian saf​ari: 9 wildlife trips beyond tigers and leopardstravel Next123 Photostories  Labrador Retriever vs Beagle: Which is a better pet dog for families with children?5 saree tips to take from South Indian 'saree queen' Samantha Ruth PrabhuHer longevity secret? Can your daily cup of coffee or tea boost your mood? Science weighs in
Research indicates that morning caffeine intake, from coffee or tea, can significantly boost positive emotions like alertness and enthusiasm. This effect is most pronounced shortly after waking and is influenced by factors such as sleep quality and social environment. Therefore, a mindful morning beverage routine can enhance mood and set a positive tone for the day.
Can your daily cup of coffee or tea boost your mood? Science weighs in | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipfood newsHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipestravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior CareNewslifestylefood-newsCan your daily cup of coffee or tea boost your mood? Science weighs inTrendingIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesCan your daily cup of coffee or tea boost your mood? Science weighs inTOI Lifestyle Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 13, 2025, 17:45 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeResearch indicates that morning caffeine intake, from coffee or tea, can significantly boost positive emotions like alertness and enthusiasm. This effect is most pronounced shortly after waking and is influenced by factors such as sleep quality and social environment. Therefore, a mindful morning beverage routine can enhance mood and set a positive tone for the day.  Starting your day with a cup of coffee or tea is a cherished ritual for millions worldwide, often believed to enhance mood, increase alertness, and provide an energising start to the morning. But how much of this is backed by science? Recent research published in Scientific Reports sheds light on the connection between caffeine consumption and emotional states in everyday life. The study indicates that caffeine intake can produce a small-to-moderate increase in positive emotions, particularly when enjoyed shortly after waking.Interestingly, these mood-boosting effects are most pronounced in the morning and can be influenced by factors such as fatigue levels, sleep quality, and social environment. The research suggests that the familiar comfort and routine of your morning cup, whether coffee or tea, may not only awaken your senses but also subtly improve your emotional well-being. This article delves into the science behind why that morning brew might be more than just a pick-me-up, exploring its effects on mood, alertness, and overall mental state throughout the day.Understanding the impact of morning coffee on moodCoffee is one of the most widely consumed beverages globally, cherished not only for its bold flavor but also for its stimulating and mood-enhancing effects. According to the study, drinking coffee shortly after waking can significantly boost positive emotions such as alertness, enthusiasm, and motivation. This suggests that your morning cup does more than just shake off sleepiness, it provides a mental lift that can help you feel more focused, productive, and optimistic throughout the morning.Interestingly, the study also notes that the mood-enhancing effects of coffee are influenced by factors like sleep quality, social context, and general fatigue levels, meaning that a well-timed cup in the right environment can maximize its benefits. This adds scientific support to the daily ritual many people swear by, showing that your morning brew can be a subtle but effective tool for improving both your mental and emotional wellbeing. Incorporating coffee thoughtfully into your routine may therefore not only jumpstart your day physically but also set a positive tone for your mindset and overall productivity.Does tea consumption enhance emotional well-being?Tea lovers have reason to celebrate too. Like coffee, tea contains caffeine, albeit in smaller amounts, and research shows that drinking tea can also lead to modest improvements in positive emotions, especially when enjoyed in the morning. Beyond caffeine, green and black teas are rich in L-theanine, an amino acid that promotes relaxation, enhances focus, and helps reduce stress. This unique combination of caffeine and L-theanine allows tea to gently boost alertness while keeping the mind calm, making it a perfect morning companion for both mental clarity and a subtle mood lift.Timing your caffeine intake for optimal mood boostTiming is a critical factor in harnessing the full mood-boosting effects of caffeine. According to the study, consuming coffee or tea within the first 2.5 hours after waking leads to a more pronounced increase in positive emotions, including alertness, enthusiasm, and overall mental sharpness. In contrast, caffeine intake later in the day, around 10–12 hours after waking, tends to have a much smaller impact on emotional state, offering minimal mood benefits. This highlights the importance of making your morning beverage an intentional part of your routine rather than just a habit.By enjoying coffee or tea early, you not only energize your body but also enhance your emotional wellbeing, giving your mind a natural lift that can improve focus, motivation, and productivity throughout the morning. Combining the caffeine boost with your usual morning rituals, like a nutritious breakfast or light exercise, can further amplify these effects, making your early hours more productive and mentally uplifting. Ultimately, the timing of your caffeine intake can play a key role in setting a positive tone for the rest of your day.Factors influencing the effectiveness of morning tea or coffeeSeveral factors can modulate how caffeine affects your mood:Tiredness: Those who are sleep-deprived or fatigued may experience stronger positive effects from caffeine.Social Context: Enjoying coffee or tea with friends or colleagues can enhance the mood-boosting effects.Individual Differences: Genetics, habitual caffeine intake, and personal sensitivity can influence results.These factors suggest that the mood benefits of coffee or tea are not solely due to caffeine itself but also the environment and personal habits surrounding its consumption.Scientific insights into caffeine's role in mood regulationThe research emphasizes that caffeine primarily boosts positive emotions, including enthusiasm, energy, and alertness, while having little effect on negative emotions such as sadness or anxiety. This finding supports what millions of coffee and tea drinkers have long observed: that their morning cup can leave them feeling more motivated, cheerful, and ready to tackle the day. By enhancing these uplifting emotions without significantly altering negative moods, caffeine offers a subtle but meaningful way to improve daily mental and emotional wellbeing.Your morning coffee or tea can indeed provide a natural mood boost, especially when consumed shortly after waking. The positive effects are most noticeable in the early hours of the day and can be influenced by fatigue levels, social settings, and individual sensitivity. By enjoying your beverage mindfully and at the right time, you can enhance your morning mood and start your day on a more positive note.Also read| Drinking ginger tea daily? 5 saree tips to take from Samantha Ruth Prabhu
Here’s how to take a few lessons from Samantha’s playbook and turn the humble saree into your ultimate style weapon.
5 saree tips to take from South Indian 'saree queen' Samantha Ruth Prabhu Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipstyleHealth+visual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior Careceleb stylestyle guidebuzzdesignersshowstimes luxuryvideosdesigner directoryNewslifestylefashionstyle-guide5 saree tips to take from South Indian 'saree queen' Samantha Ruth PrabhuTrendingIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate Countries5 saree tips to take from South Indian 'saree queen' Samantha Ruth PrabhuETimes.in /  Aug 13, 2025, 18:00 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollow us 1/7Saree lessons from the very stylish Samantha Ruth PrabhuSamantha Ruth Prabhu isn’t just a leading lady on screen, she’s a saree girl through and through. Whether she’s walking the red carpet, attending a temple visit, or promoting her latest film, Samantha has this uncanny ability to make a six-yard drape feel fresh, current, and endlessly stylish. Her Instagram alone is practically a mood board for anyone who wants to give their saree game a serious upgrade.Here’s how to take a few lessons from Samantha’s playbook and turn the humble saree into your ultimate style weapon.by TOI Lifestyle Desk 2/7​Master the art of mixing texturesOne thing Samantha does better than most is pairing contrasting textures in a way that feels intentional and luxe. You will often spot her wearing a crisp organza saree with a raw silk blouse, or a matte cotton drape with a metallic brocade blouse.The trick? The fabrics should talk to each other, not compete. If the saree has a soft, flowy drape, she’ll go for a blouse with more structure. If the saree is rich and heavy, she’ll balance it with a simpler, lighter blouse.For us mere mortals, this means stepping outside the matching-set mindset. That Kanjeevaram in your cupboard? Try pairing it with a velvet blouse for winter weddings. Got a breezy linen saree? Give it some shine with a sequin or mirror-work blouse.3/7Play with unconventional blouse stylesIf there’s one thing Samantha has taught us, it’s that the blouse can make (or break) your saree look. She isn’t afraid of experimenting, from strappy corset-style cholis to high-neck blouses with dramatic sleeves.The magic is in balancing the mood of the event with the blouse design. For traditional festivities, she leans towards elbow-length sleeves and heritage necklines. For fashion-forward occasions, she isn’t shy about trying halter necks, off-shoulder cuts, or even capes as a blouse alternative.The lesson? Think beyond the regular tailor-cut blouse. Raid Pinterest for ideas, mix in some contemporary silhouettes, and let the blouse set the tone for your entire look.4/7​Keep your jewellery intentionalSamantha’s saree looks are never weighed down with jewellery just for the sake of it. If she’s wearing a heavy, embellished saree, she’ll often let it breathe with just statement earrings. On the flip side, with simpler drapes like a plain tussar or organza, she’ll turn up the drama with chunky temple jewellery or layered necklaces.It’s about intention, not excess. Every piece she wears feels like it belongs, creating harmony instead of visual chaos.If you are styling your own saree, take a beat before reaching for the whole jewellery box. Ask yourself: is the saree the hero or the accessories? Then edit accordingly. Sometimes, less sparkle equals more impact.5/7​Nail the drape for the occasionFrom a crisp corporate pallu for a business event to a loose, casual drape for a day wedding, Samantha always tailors her saree pleats to the moment. She even experiments with belt-cinched sarees for a modern twist, a trick that works wonders for creating shape and adding a little edge.The biggest takeaway here is to treat your saree drape like styling hair or makeup: adapt it to the vibe. A tight, structured drape works for formal occasions, while a relaxed, low-pleat version feels more laid-back and bohemian.Pro tip: if you’re wearing the saree all day, make sure the pleats are pinned securely (a mishap mid-event is never chic). Samantha’s looks always appear effortless because they’re also practical, no tugging or adjusting every five minutes.6/7Let the saree reflect your moodPerhaps Samantha’s most important saree lesson is that she doesn’t wear it like a costume, she wears it like an extension of herself. Some days it’s a blush-pink floral drape that screams romantic and whimsical. Other days, it’s a strong, deep-coloured silk that says, “I mean business.”Fashion is personal, and the saree is one of the most adaptable garments in the world. Feeling playful? Go for bright colours, quirky prints, or ruffled edges. In a minimalist mood? Choose muted tones with subtle detailing.The point is: the saree isn’t just for weddings, pujas, or “special” days. Samantha wears hers to red carpets, movie promotions, and even casual brunches, proving that this centuries-old garment is as everyday-friendly as jeans if you style it right.7/7Magic of Samantha's sareesSamantha Ruth Prabhu’s saree style is the perfect blend of tradition and experimentation. She respects the garment’s heritage but refuses to treat it as untouchable. Instead, she makes it personal, modern, and infinitely wearable.So the next time you’re staring at your saree collection wondering how to make it feel fresh, remember: mix textures, play with blouse styles, be intentional with jewellery, drape for the occasion, and above all, let the saree reflect you.The magic of Samantha’s saree looks isn’t in the price tags or designer labels, it’s in the way she wears them with confidence and joy. And that, more than any styling trick, is the ultimate tip worth stealing.Follow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousSet up a mini lotus pond at home with these easy tipsindiaJanmashtami 2025: Labrador Retriever vs Beagle: Which is a better pet dog for families with children?
Are you planning to choose the right pet dog for your family? Do you have children and are thinking which popular pet dog is better-- Labrador Retriever or Beagle? Well, Labrador Retrievers and Beagles are two of the most popular breeds across the world, and both are known for their friendliness and playfulness. However, they do have certain differences that can make one dog breed more suitable for your household than the other, depending on your needs. So, here we list some key differences between the two that will help you select the right pet dog for you:
Labrador Retriever vs Beagle: Which is a better pet dog for families with children? Do you have children and are thinking which popular pet dog is better-- Labrador Retriever or Beagle? Well, Labrador Retrievers and Beagles are two of the most popular breeds across the world, and both are known for their friendliness and playfulness. However, they do have certain differences that can make one dog breed more suitable for your household than the other, depending on your needs. So, here we list some key differences between the two that will help you select the right pet dog for you:2/8TemperamentLabrador Retrievers are known for being gentle, fun-loving, and patient— which makes them perfect pets for families with kids of all ages. Beagles too are friendly and playful, but they have a stronger independent streak, which can make them a bit mischievous.3/8Size and space needsThis is one of the most striing differences between the two pet dog breeds. Labradors are large and they need more space to move freely; and so, they are more suitable for people with large homes and bungalows. Whereas, due to their small size Beagles are perfect pets for people living in apartments or smaller homes.4/8Energy levelsBoth Labradors and Beagles are active, when it comes to their energy levels. But Labs need more structured exercise and outdoor play to stay active and healthy. Whereas, Beagles have bursts of high energy but can be happy with regular short walks and play sessions too.5/8 Grooming and sheddingBoth Labs and Beagles shed moderately. However, Labradors may shed a bit more seasonally. On the contrary, due to their short coats,  Beagles are easier to groom and maintain. Both the dog breeds need regular brushing to keep their coats clean and healthy.6/8TrainabilityDue to their people pleasing nature, Labradors respond well to training and positive reinforcement. This makes them great pets even for first-time owners. Beagles, on the other hand, are intelligent but can also be stubborn. And so, a person needs to handle them with a lot of patience and consistent positive reinforcement.7/8Health issuesLabradors are known to be more prone to joint issues like hip dysplasia. Meanwhile Beagles are prone to ear infections due to their floppy ears. Both the dog breeds need regular vet care to ensure they stay healthy.8/8Compatibility with kids Labradors are known for their patience and tolerance, which makes them perfect for younger children. While Beagles are equally affectionate, they may be better with slightly older kids who can match their playful energy and need for independence too at times.Follow Us On Social Media Visual Stories
