Liver damage warning signs: Constant itching on hands and feet could be serious
Unexplained itching on hands and feet could signal liver issues. Doctors say, this itching, especially on palms and soles, might be due to bile acid buildup. Liver disorders like cholestasis or cirrhosis are often linked. Watch for night-time itching, fatigue, or jaundice. Consult a doctor if symptoms persist. Simple steps can help soothe the itch.
Liver damage warning signs: Constant itching on hands and feet could be serious | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior Carehealth newsfitnessdietmental healthcoronavirusalternative therapiesweight lossvideosdiseasesyogaNewslifestylehealth-fitnesshealth-newsLiver damage warning signs: Constant itching on hands and feet could be seriousTrendingIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesLiver damage warning signs: Constant itching on hands and feet could be seriousTOI Lifestyle Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 13, 2025, 15:30 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeUnexplained itching on hands and feet could signal liver issues. Doctors say, this itching, especially on palms and soles, might be due to bile acid buildup. Liver disorders like cholestasis or cirrhosis are often linked. Watch for night-time itching, fatigue, or jaundice. Consult a doctor if symptoms persist. Simple steps can help soothe the itch.  Itchy hands and feet are commonly mistaken for dry skin, allergies, or minor irritations. However, when the itching is persistent, unexplained, and occurs without a visible rash, it could signal an underlying liver problem. Medical experts highlight that such itching, especially when concentrated on the palms and soles, may result from a buildup of bile acids in the bloodstream due to impaired liver function. This condition is often associated with disorders like cholestasis or liver cirrhosis. If the itching worsens at night, doesn’t respond to moisturisers, or is accompanied by fatigue or jaundice, it’s essential to consult a doctor promptly.Why liver damage can cause itching on hands and feetWhen the liver is not functioning properly, bile acids and toxins can build up in the bloodstream. These substances may then irritate nerve endings under the skin, leading to an intense, persistent itch, especially on the palms of the hands and soles of the feet.This condition is known as cholestatic pruritus, and it often occurs without a visible rash, making it harder to diagnose. It is commonly linked to liver disorders such as:Primary biliary cholangitis (PBC)Primary sclerosing cholangitis (PSC)CirrhosisIntrahepatic cholestasis of pregnancy (ICP)Unknown Myths About Liver Disease BustedCauses of itching in liver disease:Scientists have not yet pinpointed a single cause behind the itching (pruritus) associated with liver disease. According to Healthline, it is believed to result from a combination of factors, which may include:1. Bile saltsIn liver disease, bile salts can accumulate beneath the skin, potentially triggering itching. However, this link isn’t consistent, some individuals with high bile salt levels don’t experience itching, while others itch despite normal levels.2. HistaminesMany people with liver-related itching have elevated histamine levels, although antihistamines are often ineffective in providing relief.3. SerotoninSerotonin may influence how the brain perceives itching, though its exact role remains unclear.4. Pregnancy and hormone therapyItching can worsen during pregnancy or while undergoing hormone replacement therapy, likely due to hormonal fluctuations.5. Serum alkaline phosphatase (ALP)Elevated ALP levels are frequently seen in individuals experiencing itch-related liver conditions, suggesting a possible connection.Key symptoms to watch forIt’s important to differentiate everyday skin irritation from liver-related itching. Below are signs that your itching may be a warning from your liver:Itching without a rashMost skin conditions cause itching accompanied by redness, bumps, or inflammation. In contrast, liver-related itching is intense yet rash-free, affecting deep layers under the skin.It worsens at nightLiver-related itching typically becomes more severe in the evening or during sleep. Night-time itching can severely affect your quality of life and disrupt rest.It starts on hands and feetItchiness often begins in the palms and soles before spreading. These areas are sensitive to bile salt accumulation, a hallmark of liver dysfunction.Associated liver symptomsOther signs of liver problems may include:FatigueYellowing of the skin or eyes (jaundice)Dark urinePale stoolsUnexplained weight lossWhen to consult a doctorYou should seek medical advice if:Itching is persistent, unexplained, or resistant to moisturisersYou notice signs of jaundice or chronic fatigueThe itching is disrupting your sleep or daily lifeA healthcare provider may order liver function tests, including bilirubin, alkaline phosphatase (ALP), and ultrasound scans to investigate further.Tips to prevent itching and protect your skinAvoid scratching, even when the urge is strong, as it can break the skin and increase the risk of infection. If nighttime itching is a problem, consider wearing gloves to bed to prevent unconscious scratching.Here are additional ways to soothe itching and reduce skin irritation:Bathe or shower with warm or cool water, never hot.Limit time spent in hot environments or direct sunlight.Use mild, fragrance-free soaps to avoid further irritation.Apply gentle, unscented moisturisers regularly to keep skin hydrated.Use a cold, damp cloth on itchy areas to ease discomfort.Stay away from substances or materials that irritate your skin.Wear gloves when handling harsh cleaning products or chemicals.Opt for loose, breathable clothing to prevent chafing.Use a humidifier in dry weather, especially during winter.Disclaimer: This article is for informational purposes only and does not substitute professional medical advice. If you experience persistent itching or other symptoms, please consult a healthcare professional for proper diagnosis and treatment.Also read | 5 common reasons behind liver disease you might be overlookingAbout the AuthorTOI Lifestyle DeskThe TOI Lifestyle Desk is a dynamic team of dedicated journalists who, with unwavering passion and commitment, sift through the pulse of the nation to curate a vibrant tapestry of lifestyle news for The Times of India readers. New study warns! Routine AI use may affect doctors’ tumor diagnostic skills by 20%
Artificial Intelligence is changing healthcare. It helps in early disease detection and treatment. A recent study shows doctors may lose skills if they depend too much on AI. When AI support was removed, doctors' tumor detection skills dropped. Experts suggest using AI as a support tool, not a replacement. Regular training and critical thinking are important to maintain skills.
New study warns! Routine AI use may affect doctors’ tumor diagnostic skills by 20%TrendingIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesNew study warns! Routine AI use may affect doctors’ tumor diagnostic skills by 20%TOI Lifestyle Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 13, 2025, 19:00 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeArtificial Intelligence is changing healthcare. It helps in early disease detection and treatment. A recent study shows doctors may lose skills if they depend too much on AI. When AI support was removed, doctors' tumor detection skills dropped. Experts suggest using AI as a support tool, not a replacement. Regular training and critical thinking are important to maintain skills.   Artificial Intelligence (AI) is transforming healthcare, offering tools that improve early disease detection, diagnostic accuracy, and treatment planning. AI-assisted systems can help clinicians identify conditions such as pre-cancerous growths or subtle anomalies that might be missed otherwise, boosting patient outcomes and overall clinical efficiency. However, recent research highlights a potential downside: excessive reliance on AI may lead to skill erosion among healthcare professionals. Even experienced doctors who regularly use AI tools may find their independent decision-making and observational abilities decline over time. AI has the potential to transform medicine, improve patient outcomes, and streamline healthcare workflows. However, the recent study serves as a reminder that over-reliance on technology can erode critical skills, even among experienced doctors. A balanced approach—where AI supports rather than replaces human judgment—is essential for sustaining both high-quality patient care and professional expertise.Doctors’ ability to spot pre-cancerous growths declines when AI is removedA recent study in The Lancet Gastroenterology and Hepatology, investigated how AI impacts colonoscopy performance. The researchers found that AI assistance enabled doctors to detect pre-cancerous growths in the colon more effectively, potentially preventing progression to colorectal cancer.However, a concerning trend emerged: when AI support was removed, doctors’ ability to detect tumors dropped by approximately 20%, even compared with rates recorded before AI introduction. This suggests that clinicians may unconsciously rely on AI cues, reducing their independent observational skills.Global adoption of AI in healthcare systemsHealthcare systems worldwide are increasingly investing in AI technology. AI is being positioned as a tool to boost diagnostic accuracy, improve workflow efficiency, and enhance patient safety.For instance, in 2025, the British government announced £11 million (S$19 million) in funding for a trial exploring how AI can facilitate earlier breast cancer detection. While AI offers promising benefits, these developments highlight the importance of maintaining human expertise alongside technological advancements.Doctors losing skills due to AI dependence: Here’s what the study foundThe study revealed that AI can inadvertently encourage over-reliance, even among highly skilled clinicians. According to the research paper, AI support can result in doctors becoming less motivated, less focused, and less responsible when making decisions independently.The researchers studied four endoscopy centers in Poland, comparing colonoscopy detection rates three months before and after AI implementation. The procedures were randomized: some were performed with AI guidance, others without. The difference in detection rates highlighted the risk of skill erosion caused by dependency on AI tools.AI can reduce tumor detection skills in expert doctorsInterestingly, the study participants were 19 highly experienced doctors, each with over 2,000 colonoscopies completed. Despite their expertise, AI still affected their ability to detect tumors without assistance.Professor Yuichi Mori, one of the study authors from the University of Oslo, warned that skill degradation could worsen as AI becomes more sophisticated.Dr. Omer Ahmad, a gastroenterologist at University College Hospital London, added:“Although AI continues to offer great promise to enhance clinical outcomes, we must also safeguard against the quiet erosion of fundamental skills required for high-quality endoscopy.”He noted that the effect could be more pronounced for trainees or novice doctors, who might become overly dependent on AI before mastering essential diagnostic skills.Excessive AI use may reduce brain engagement and focus; study revealsConcerns about over-reliance on AI extend beyond healthcare. A 2025 MIT study found that students using OpenAI’s ChatGPT to write essays demonstrated less cognitive engagement and brain activity, illustrating how AI can unintentionally reduce critical thinking skills.These findings underscore the need for balanced AI integration—leveraging AI’s advantages while ensuring that human expertise and cognitive abilities remain intact.Strategies to maintain skills while using AITo mitigate skill erosion, healthcare professionals and institutions can adopt several strategies:AI as a support tool, not a replacement – Use AI to assist decisions while maintaining independent judgment.Regular performance monitoring – Track detection accuracy with and without AI to identify skill gaps.Structured training rotations – Alternate between AI-assisted and manual procedures to preserve proficiency.Active critical thinking – Encourage clinicians to question and evaluate AI suggestions rather than blindly following them.Continuous education – Reinforce fundamental diagnostic skills through workshops and refresher courses.By implementing these measures, healthcare systems can maximise AI’s benefits while safeguarding essential clinical competencies.Disclaimer: The information presented in this article is for educational and informational purposes only and is not intended as medical advice. Enhance skin glow naturally: Nutritionist reveals an easy homemade antioxidant juice, benefits, and tips for glowing skin
Nutritionist Anjali Mukerjee suggests a homemade juice rich in antioxidants to combat skin ageing. This juice, packed with amla, beetroot, black grapes, and pomegranate, fights free radicals, boosts collagen, and enhances skin elasticity. Regular consumption, along with a balanced lifestyle, can slow visible signs of ageing and promote youthful skin.
Enhance skin glow naturally: Nutritionist reveals an easy homemade antioxidant juice, benefits, and tips for glowing skin | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipbeautyHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior CareNewslifestylebeautyEnhance skin glow naturally: Nutritionist reveals an easy homemade antioxidant juice, benefits, and tips for glowing skinTrendingIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesEnhance skin glow naturally: Nutritionist reveals an easy homemade antioxidant juice, benefits, and tips for glowing skinTOI Lifestyle Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 13, 2025, 17:46 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeNutritionist Anjali Mukerjee suggests a homemade juice rich in antioxidants to combat skin ageing. This juice, packed with amla, beetroot, black grapes, and pomegranate, fights free radicals, boosts collagen, and enhances skin elasticity. Regular consumption, along with a balanced lifestyle, can slow visible signs of ageing and promote youthful skin.  Ever wish you could slow down ageing and maintain radiant, youthful skin? Nutritionist Anjali Mukerjee highlights that glowing skin isn’t just about creams or treatments—it starts with your diet. She recommends a simple, homemade juice packed with antioxidants, vitamins, and essential nutrients that help combat fine lines, dullness, and sagging. By nourishing your body from the inside, this juice supports skin regeneration, improves elasticity, and fights oxidative stress caused by free radicals. Regular consumption can enhance hydration, brighten complexion, and slow visible signs of ageing. Integrating such nutrient-rich beverages into your daily routine offers a natural, affordable, and effective approach to long-term skin health.How diet and antioxidants can slow visible signs of ageing with these powerful superfoodsAgeing is a natural process, but the speed at which your body shows signs of ageing—such as wrinkles, dark spots, and loss of skin elasticity—can be influenced by diet. Foods rich in antioxidants help combat oxidative stress and protect skin cells, potentially delaying visible signs of ageing.Nutritionist Anjali Mukerjee highlights that incorporating antioxidant-rich ingredients like amla (Indian gooseberry), pomegranate, and black grapes into your diet can strengthen the skin’s natural defense system and enhance collagen production, essential for firm, youthful skin.https://www.instagram.com/p/DNKcRRTxtEL/ Why amla, beetroot, and grapes are anti-aging powerhousesBeetroot: Boost circulation and detoxifyBeetroot is packed with vitamin C, iron, and nitrates, which improve blood circulation, enhance skin elasticity, and aid the body’s detoxification process. Improved blood flow ensures that nutrients reach skin cells efficiently, giving the skin an inner glow and youthful vitality.Amla: Collagen booster and free radical fighterAmla is a staple in traditional Indian health practices, revered for its high vitamin C content and potent antioxidant properties. It helps in collagen synthesis, reduces oxidative stress, and supports cellular repair. Together, these benefits slow down the appearance of fine lines, sagging, and pigmentation.Black grapes and pomegranate: Skin-protective nutrientsBlack grapes and pomegranate are rich in polyphenols and antioxidants, which work synergistically with amla and beetroot to neutralize free radicals, prevent cellular damage, and promote skin hydration and elasticity.Homemade anti-ageing juice recipeIngredients:1 small amla (Indian gooseberry)1 cup pomegranate seeds1 cup black grapesBlack salt and chat masala to tastePreparation steps:Grate the deseeded amla and strain it to extract juice.Juice the black grapes and pomegranate separately.Mix all the juices together.Add a pinch of black salt and chat masala for taste.Serve immediately for maximum freshness and potency.Pro tip: Consume this juice within 20 minutes of preparation to retain its antioxidant properties.How this juice fights skin ageingFree radicals are unstable molecules that can damage skin cells, accelerating ageing symptoms like fine lines, pigmentation, and sagging. They are produced naturally through metabolism, environmental exposure, and UV radiation.Antioxidants found in amla, beetroot, pomegranate, and black grapes neutralize free radicals, protect cellular structures, and nourish the skin from the inside out. Regular consumption, combined with a healthy diet, exercise, and proper sleep, can significantly slow down visible ageing while improving overall well-being.Additional tips for healthy, youthful skinStay hydrated: Drink plenty of water to maintain skin elasticity.Balanced diet: Include whole grains, nuts, seeds, and leafy greens for nutrients that support skin health.Regular exercise: Improves circulation, which boosts nutrient delivery to skin cells.Adequate sleep: Allows cellular repair and rejuvenation, essential for youthful skin.About the AuthorTOI Lifestyle DeskThe TOI Lifestyle Desk is a dynamic team of dedicated journalists who, with unwavering passion and commitment, sift through the pulse of the nation to curate a vibrant tapestry of lifestyle news for The Times of India readers. At the TOI Lifestyle Desk, we go beyond the obvious, delving into the extraordinary. Consider us your lifestyle companion, providing a daily dose of inspiration and information. Whether you're seeking the latest fashion trends, travel escapades, culinary delights, or wellness tips, the TOI Lifestyle Desk is your one-stop destination for an enriching lifestyle experience.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousSet up a mini lotus pond at home with these easy tipsLifestyleAttractive looks of Srithika Saneeshtv10 creatures that can walk on waterLifestyleSheet masks out, Kareena Kapoor Khan’s DIY napkin mask inLifestyleBhagyashri Borse charms with her gorgeous outfitsEntertainmentMost affordable diesel cars under Rs 12 lakh: Kia Syros, Mahindra Thar and moreautoThese Zodiac Signs Play the Victim When They’re Actually in Controlastrology10 things to know before getting a pet rabbitLifestyleDiarrhea: What to eat and avoid when the stomach is upsetLifestyleTaarak Mehta fame Palak Sindhwani’s top 10 gorgeous outfitstv Next123 Photostories  Labrador Retriever vs Beagle: Which is a better pet dog for families with children?'Coolie': Five big reasons to experience Rajinikanth and Lokesh Kanagaraj’s film on the big screenCooku With Comali 6: From Shabana Shajahan to Lakshmy Ramakrishnan – Meet the top 6 cooks of the seasonAnanya Panday moments that show her unstoppable rise to stardom7 brain-boosting foods every child should eat and quick recipes8.5 quintals of adulterated mawa seized in Hisar: 5 ways to do mawa purity test at homeFrom reunion with Asit Kumar Modi to unseen pictures: Times when Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah’s Disha Vakani aka Dayaben made headlinesThis is what happens when you drink fennel tea on an empty stomachBoney Kapoor celebrates wife Sridevi's 62nd birth anniversary; Is it a migraine or a headache? Understanding the key differences
Migraines, often mistaken for common headaches, are neurological disorders distinguished by intense pain and symptoms like nausea and light sensitivity. Tension, sinus, and cluster headaches each have unique characteristics and triggers. Seeking medical advice is crucial for severe or worsening headaches, enabling accurate diagnosis and tailored treatment plans, alongside lifestyle adjustments, to effectively manage these conditions.
Is it a migraine or a headache? Understanding the key differences | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior Carehealth newsfitnessdietmental healthcoronavirusalternative therapiesweight lossvideosdiseasesyogaNewslifestylehealth-fitnesshealth-newsIs it a migraine or a headache? Understanding the key differencesTrendingIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIs it a migraine or a headache? Understanding the key differencesTOI Lifestyle Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 13, 2025, 18:30 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeMigraines, often mistaken for common headaches, are neurological disorders distinguished by intense pain and symptoms like nausea and light sensitivity. Tension, sinus, and cluster headaches each have unique characteristics and triggers. Seeking medical advice is crucial for severe or worsening headaches, enabling accurate diagnosis and tailored treatment plans, alongside lifestyle adjustments, to effectively manage these conditions.  Headaches affect millions worldwide, but not all headaches are the same. Migraines are a unique neurological disorder, often confused with common headaches, leading to misdiagnosis and ineffective treatment. Unlike typical headaches, migraines cause intense, throbbing pain, often accompanied by symptoms like nausea, sensitivity to light and sound, and visual disturbances. Understanding the key differences between migraines and tension or cluster headaches is essential for accurate diagnosis and effective migraine treatment. Recognising migraine symptoms early can significantly improve quality of life and help manage this debilitating condition with proper medical care and lifestyle changes.How to differentiate migraine and headachesWhile migraines and common headaches both involve head pain, they differ significantly in their causes, symptoms, and severity. Decode Your Migraines: Understanding Common Triggers And SolutionsMigraines are a neurological condition characterised by intense, often throbbing pain on one side of the head, accompanied by symptoms like nausea, sensitivity to light and sound, and visual disturbances known as aura. In contrast, typical headaches such as tension headaches usually present as a milder, steady, band-like pressure around the head without these additional symptoms. What is a migraineMigraines are intense, recurring headaches accompanied by additional symptoms beyond just pain. They can last from 4 to 72 hours and are often debilitating.Common characteristics of migraines include:One-sided pain: Typically throbbing or pulsating, often on one side of the head.Aura: Visual disturbances such as flashing lights, zigzag lines, or blind spots that occur before the headache.Sensitivity: Increased sensitivity to light (photophobia), sound (phonophobia), and sometimes smells.Nausea and vomiting: Often accompany the headache phase.Other symptoms: Fatigue, dizziness, and difficulty concentrating.Common triggers include hormonal changes (e.g., menstruation), stress, certain foods and drinks (like caffeine or alcohol), dehydration, and changes in sleep patterns.What is a tension headacheTension headaches are the most common type of headache and are generally less severe than migraines.Key features:Pain description: A steady, dull, tightening or pressing sensation, often described as a "band" around the forehead or the back of the head and neck.Pain intensity: Mild to moderate.Duration: Lasts from 30 minutes to several hours, sometimes even days.Associated symptoms: Usually no nausea or vomiting; sensitivity to light or sound is rare.Triggers often include stress, poor posture, anxiety, fatigue, and muscle strain.Sinus headacheSinus headaches arise from inflammation or infection in the sinuses and often accompany sinusitis.Symptoms include:Pain and pressure: Felt around the forehead, cheeks, and eyes.Other symptoms: Nasal congestion, thick nasal discharge, fever, and fatigue.Sinus headaches are often mistaken for migraines but usually resolve with treatment of the underlying sinus infection.Cluster headacheCluster headaches are relatively rare but extremely painful headaches that occur in cyclical patterns or clusters.Characteristics include:Pain location: Severe, burning or piercing pain around one eye or temple.Duration: Usually last between 15 minutes and 3 hours.Frequency: Can occur multiple times a day during cluster periods.Associated symptoms: Red or watery eye, nasal congestion or runny nose on the affected side, drooping eyelid.Cluster headaches often occur in seasonal patterns and may be triggered by alcohol or strong smells.How to know when to see a doctorSeek medical advice if you experience:A sudden, severe headache unlike any before.Headaches that worsen or become more frequent.Headaches accompanied by neurological symptoms such as vision changes, weakness, difficulty speaking, or confusion.Headaches that interfere significantly with daily activities.Headaches following a head injury.Diagnosis and treatmentDiagnosis usually involves:A detailed medical history and description of symptoms.Physical and neurological examinations.Sometimes imaging tests like MRI or CT scans to rule out other causes.Treatment options vary depending on the headache typeMigraines: Pain relief with over-the-counter medications, triptans, anti-nausea drugs; preventive medications; lifestyle and dietary changes.Tension headaches: Painkillers like paracetamol or ibuprofen, stress reduction techniques, improved posture.Sinus headaches: Treating the underlying infection with decongestants, antihistamines, or antibiotics if necessary.Cluster headaches: Fast-acting treatments like oxygen therapy, triptans, and preventive medications prescribed by specialists.Lifestyle tips to manage headaches and migrainesMaintain a regular sleep schedule.Stay hydrated.Manage stress through relaxation techniques such as meditation or yoga.Avoid known triggers, such as specific foods or environmental factors.Engage in regular physical exercise.Keep a headache diary to identify patterns and triggers.Disclaimer: This article is intended for informational purposes only and does not replace professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment. If you experience severe, persistent, or worsening headaches or migraines, or if your symptoms are accompanied by neurological changes please consult a qualified healthcare professional promptly. How gout increases your risk of developing type 2 diabetes: Know the link between the two
Gout and type 2 diabetes often coexist, exacerbating metabolic health issues through shared risk factors like obesity and poor diet. Insulin resistance links these conditions, impacting glucose metabolism and uric acid excretion. Managing both effectively requires lifestyle adjustments, including diet, exercise, hydration, and smart medication choices to mitigate long-term cardiovascular and kidney risks.
How gout increases your risk of developing type 2 diabetes: Know the link between the two | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior Carehealth newsfitnessdietmental healthcoronavirusalternative therapiesweight lossvideosdiseasesyogaNewslifestylehealth-fitnesshealth-newsHow gout increases your risk of developing type 2 diabetes: Know the link between the twoTrendingIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesHow gout increases your risk of developing type 2 diabetes: Know the link between the twoTOI Lifestyle Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 13, 2025, 17:30 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeGout and type 2 diabetes often coexist, exacerbating metabolic health issues through shared risk factors like obesity and poor diet. Insulin resistance links these conditions, impacting glucose metabolism and uric acid excretion. Managing both effectively requires lifestyle adjustments, including diet, exercise, hydration, and smart medication choices to mitigate long-term cardiovascular and kidney risks.  Gout and type 2 diabetes frequently occur together, creating a cycle that can significantly harm metabolic health. Gout results from the buildup of uric acid crystals in the joints, causing severe inflammation and pain. Type 2 diabetes is characterised by insulin resistance and elevated blood sugar levels. Both conditions share common risk factors, including excess body weight, diets high in sugar and processed foods, and a lack of physical activity. Understanding the connection between gout and diabetes is crucial for effective management, helping to prevent complications and improve overall health and quality of life.Understanding gout and diabetesGoutGout occurs when excess uric acid in the blood forms sharp crystals in the joints. This can trigger intense inflammation, causing severe pain and discomfort. Uric acid is a waste product generated from the breakdown of purines, substances found naturally in the body and certain foods. When the body produces too much uric acid or cannot eliminate it efficiently through the kidneys, levels build up, leading to gout. DiabetesDiabetes is a chronic condition that affects how your body processes blood sugar (glucose), which is a vital energy source. In type 2 diabetes, the most common form, the body becomes resistant to insulin, a hormone that regulates blood sugar levels. Over time, this leads to elevated glucose in the blood, which can cause damage to organs, nerves, and blood vessels. The link between gout and type 2 diabetesExtensive studies show that individuals diagnosed with gout face a substantially higher likelihood of developing type 2 diabetes than those without. The persistent inflammation and elevated uric acid levels in gout contribute to metabolic disturbances that impair insulin sensitivity. Over time, chronic inflammation can interfere with glucose metabolism, making blood sugar control more difficult. This impact is particularly pronounced in women, who often show a stronger correlation between gout and future diabetes. By understanding this risk, healthcare providers can prioritise early monitoring and preventive strategies.How insulin resistance connects diabetes with goutA key link between gout and diabetes lies in insulin resistance. Uric acid appears to disrupt insulin signalling, reducing the body’s ability to use glucose effectively and paving the way for elevated blood sugar. Concurrently, insulin resistance impairs uric acid excretion by the kidneys, elevating uric acid levels and promoting gout attacks. Both conditions also involve overlapping genetic predispositions, genes that influence fat metabolism, inflammation, and the handling of uric acid and glucose often overlap, creating a biological bridge between the two disorders.When diabetes might lower your gout riskInterestingly, the relationship isn’t completely one-way. Certain forms of diabetes, particularly less-managed type 1 diabetes in men, seem to be linked with a lower incidence of gout. One theory suggests that high blood sugar levels may suppress inflammatory responses, thereby reducing the risk of gout flares. That said, this potential protective effect must be balanced against the long-term complications of poorly controlled diabetes, such as cardiovascular and kidney damage.Managing gout and diabetes effectivelyA unified strategy can help manage both gout and diabetes simultaneously, here’s how:1. Maintain a healthy weight and stay activeExcess body weight promotes both insulin resistance and uric acid build-up. Regular moderate exercise, such as brisk walking, swimming, or cycling, helps improve insulin sensitivity and aids in maintaining healthy uric acid levels through daily sweating.2. Embrace a balanced, low‑purine dietFocus on whole foods rich in fibre, lean protein, and low-glycaemic starches. Limit intake of purine-heavy foods like red meat, shellfish, and sugary beverages, which can trigger gout attacks and destabilise blood sugar. 3. Prioritise hydrationAdequate hydration supports kidney function and uric acid elimination. Drinking water throughout the day helps dilute serum uric acid and may prevent crystal formation in joints.4. Smart medication choicesSome medications used to manage diabetes offer additional benefits by promoting uric acid excretion. When prescribing for patients with both gout and diabetes, physicians may also consider adjusting uric acid-lowering therapies like allopurinol or febuxostat alongside blood glucose management drugs.Why this mattersBoth gout and diabetes significantly raise the risk of developing cardiovascular and kidney disease. Having both conditions amplifies that danger. By understanding how they interact and tackling both through lifestyle changes, informed medication use, and regular monitoring, patients and clinicians can greatly reduce long-term complications and improve quality of life.Disclaimer: This information is provided for educational purposes only and is not intended to replace professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Always consult a qualified healthcare provider for personalised advice regarding gout, diabetes, or any other medical condition. 87-year-old Sheila Isaacs reveals her one true love for staying healthy
Sheila Isaacs’ story is a reminder that movement is not just about physical benefits; it’s a way to keep the spirit alive. Whether it’s pedalling down a country lane or cycling by an open garage door, the joy of the ride can be the best medicine of all.
Her longevity secret? 87-year-old Sheila Isaacs reveals her one true love for staying healthy Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior Carehealth newsfitnessdietmental healthcoronavirusalternative therapiesweight lossvideosdiseasesyogaNewslifestylehealth-fitnesshealth-newsHer longevity secret? 87-year-old Sheila Isaacs reveals her one true love for staying healthyTrendingIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesHer longevity secret? 87-year-old Sheila Isaacs reveals her one true love for staying healthyTOI Lifestyle Desk / ETimes.in /  Aug 13, 2025, 18:00 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollow us 1/6What Sheila's love teaches us about longevityFor many, retirement means slowing down. For Sheila Isaacs, it meant gearing up, literally. Now 87, Sheila has been competing in triathlons for over 35 years, and the one activity that has stolen her heart is cycling. It’s more than just exercise for her, it’s joy, freedom, and the key to staying strong well into her 80s.In a recent interview with Women’s Health, Sheila shared how her love for cycling has evolved over the years and why it continues to keep her fit. But what exactly makes cycling such a powerful tool for healthy ageing? 2/6Cycling through the yearsSheila’s relationship with cycling has changed with age. In her 80s, tall racing bikes became harder to mount, so she switched to a shorter stationary bike indoors, still positioned by the open garage door to soak in fresh air and outdoor views.Modifying workouts with age isn’t quitting, it’s smart training. As joints become more sensitive, high-impact activities like running can strain knees and hips. Switching to a low-impact activity like cycling helps maintain cardiovascular health without overloading the joints. It’s a practical example of the saying: “Train smarter, not harder.”3/6Why cycling keeps the body youngerCycling isn’t just a leg workout. It engages the core, improves balance, and boosts cardiovascular endurance. Sheila alternates cycling days with swimming and weightlifting, which keeps her muscles challenged and prevents overuse injuries.According to studies, regular cycling helps maintain bone density, muscle mass, and coordination, all of which naturally decline with age. The steady pedalling motion also promotes better blood circulation, which supports brain function and lowers the risk of age-related cognitive decline.4/6The science of fun and longevitySheila admits that her biggest shift came when she stopped stressing over races and simply started enjoying them. To her, race day is “a swim, a bike ride, and a walk.” That mindset has kept her going for decades.​Researchers have found that people who exercise for enjoyment, not obligation, are far more likely to stick to it long-term. Fun releases dopamine and endorphins, the “happy hormones” that not only lift mood but also reduce inflammation, one of the key factors in age-related diseases.5/6Tracking progress without obsessionSheila has been logging her workouts for 30 years, time, distance, mileage, and even how she feels. This habit helps her adjust training when her joints feel sore and ensures she never pushes beyond healthy limits.Fitness tracking isn’t about chasing numbers; it’s about listening to the body. Studies show that self-monitoring increases awareness of physical limits, which lowers the risk of injury and improves long-term adherence to exercise. It’s the difference between exercising for a few years and exercising for a lifetime.6/6The lesson in Sheila’s pedal powerSheila’s cycling story isn’t just about stamina; it’s about adaptability, joy, and community. At her 200th triathlon, she raced alongside her daughter and granddaughter. Her goal? Not winning, but finishing healthy and happy.This outlook aligns with what longevity experts often say: social connections and meaningful activities are as vital as physical fitness for a long, healthy life. Cycling has given Sheila both a reason to move and a circle of fellow athletes to share it with.[Disclaimer: This article is based on Sheila Isaacs’ personal experience as shared with Women’s Health. Cycling has many proven health benefits, but exercise routines should be tailored to individual needs and medical conditions. Always seek professional advice before starting or modifying any fitness program.]Follow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousSet up a mini lotus pond at home with these easy tipsindiaJanmashtami 2025: How to make Makhana Paag at home forChhappan BhogFoodAttractive looks of Srithika SaneeshindiaSheet masks out, Kareena Kapoor Khan’s DIY napkin mask inindia10 creatures that can walk on waterindia​Bhagyashri Borse charms with her gorgeous outfits​indiaThese Zodiac Signs Play the Victim When They’re Actually in Controlindia10 things to know before getting a pet rabbitindiaThe Great Indian saf​ari: 9 wildlife trips beyond tigers and leopardstravel Next123 Photostories  Labrador Retriever vs Beagle: Which is a better pet dog for families with children?5 saree tips to take from South Indian 'saree queen' Samantha Ruth PrabhuHer longevity secret? Can your daily cup of coffee or tea boost your mood? Science weighs in
Research indicates that morning caffeine intake, from coffee or tea, can significantly boost positive emotions like alertness and enthusiasm. This effect is most pronounced shortly after waking and is influenced by factors such as sleep quality and social environment. Therefore, a mindful morning beverage routine can enhance mood and set a positive tone for the day.
Can your daily cup of coffee or tea boost your mood? Science weighs in | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipfood newsHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipestravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior CareNewslifestylefood-newsCan your daily cup of coffee or tea boost your mood? Science weighs inTrendingIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesCan your daily cup of coffee or tea boost your mood? Science weighs inTOI Lifestyle Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 13, 2025, 17:45 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeResearch indicates that morning caffeine intake, from coffee or tea, can significantly boost positive emotions like alertness and enthusiasm. This effect is most pronounced shortly after waking and is influenced by factors such as sleep quality and social environment. Therefore, a mindful morning beverage routine can enhance mood and set a positive tone for the day.  Starting your day with a cup of coffee or tea is a cherished ritual for millions worldwide, often believed to enhance mood, increase alertness, and provide an energising start to the morning. But how much of this is backed by science? Recent research published in Scientific Reports sheds light on the connection between caffeine consumption and emotional states in everyday life. The study indicates that caffeine intake can produce a small-to-moderate increase in positive emotions, particularly when enjoyed shortly after waking.Interestingly, these mood-boosting effects are most pronounced in the morning and can be influenced by factors such as fatigue levels, sleep quality, and social environment. The research suggests that the familiar comfort and routine of your morning cup, whether coffee or tea, may not only awaken your senses but also subtly improve your emotional well-being. This article delves into the science behind why that morning brew might be more than just a pick-me-up, exploring its effects on mood, alertness, and overall mental state throughout the day.Understanding the impact of morning coffee on moodCoffee is one of the most widely consumed beverages globally, cherished not only for its bold flavor but also for its stimulating and mood-enhancing effects. According to the study, drinking coffee shortly after waking can significantly boost positive emotions such as alertness, enthusiasm, and motivation. This suggests that your morning cup does more than just shake off sleepiness, it provides a mental lift that can help you feel more focused, productive, and optimistic throughout the morning.Interestingly, the study also notes that the mood-enhancing effects of coffee are influenced by factors like sleep quality, social context, and general fatigue levels, meaning that a well-timed cup in the right environment can maximize its benefits. This adds scientific support to the daily ritual many people swear by, showing that your morning brew can be a subtle but effective tool for improving both your mental and emotional wellbeing. Incorporating coffee thoughtfully into your routine may therefore not only jumpstart your day physically but also set a positive tone for your mindset and overall productivity.Does tea consumption enhance emotional well-being?Tea lovers have reason to celebrate too. Like coffee, tea contains caffeine, albeit in smaller amounts, and research shows that drinking tea can also lead to modest improvements in positive emotions, especially when enjoyed in the morning. Beyond caffeine, green and black teas are rich in L-theanine, an amino acid that promotes relaxation, enhances focus, and helps reduce stress. This unique combination of caffeine and L-theanine allows tea to gently boost alertness while keeping the mind calm, making it a perfect morning companion for both mental clarity and a subtle mood lift.Timing your caffeine intake for optimal mood boostTiming is a critical factor in harnessing the full mood-boosting effects of caffeine. According to the study, consuming coffee or tea within the first 2.5 hours after waking leads to a more pronounced increase in positive emotions, including alertness, enthusiasm, and overall mental sharpness. In contrast, caffeine intake later in the day, around 10–12 hours after waking, tends to have a much smaller impact on emotional state, offering minimal mood benefits. This highlights the importance of making your morning beverage an intentional part of your routine rather than just a habit.By enjoying coffee or tea early, you not only energize your body but also enhance your emotional wellbeing, giving your mind a natural lift that can improve focus, motivation, and productivity throughout the morning. Combining the caffeine boost with your usual morning rituals, like a nutritious breakfast or light exercise, can further amplify these effects, making your early hours more productive and mentally uplifting. Ultimately, the timing of your caffeine intake can play a key role in setting a positive tone for the rest of your day.Factors influencing the effectiveness of morning tea or coffeeSeveral factors can modulate how caffeine affects your mood:Tiredness: Those who are sleep-deprived or fatigued may experience stronger positive effects from caffeine.Social Context: Enjoying coffee or tea with friends or colleagues can enhance the mood-boosting effects.Individual Differences: Genetics, habitual caffeine intake, and personal sensitivity can influence results.These factors suggest that the mood benefits of coffee or tea are not solely due to caffeine itself but also the environment and personal habits surrounding its consumption.Scientific insights into caffeine's role in mood regulationThe research emphasizes that caffeine primarily boosts positive emotions, including enthusiasm, energy, and alertness, while having little effect on negative emotions such as sadness or anxiety. This finding supports what millions of coffee and tea drinkers have long observed: that their morning cup can leave them feeling more motivated, cheerful, and ready to tackle the day. By enhancing these uplifting emotions without significantly altering negative moods, caffeine offers a subtle but meaningful way to improve daily mental and emotional wellbeing.Your morning coffee or tea can indeed provide a natural mood boost, especially when consumed shortly after waking. The positive effects are most noticeable in the early hours of the day and can be influenced by fatigue levels, social settings, and individual sensitivity. By enjoying your beverage mindfully and at the right time, you can enhance your morning mood and start your day on a more positive note.Also read| Drinking ginger tea daily? 5 saree tips to take from Samantha Ruth Prabhu
Here’s how to take a few lessons from Samantha’s playbook and turn the humble saree into your ultimate style weapon.
5 saree tips to take from South Indian 'saree queen' Samantha Ruth Prabhu Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipstyleHealth+visual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior Careceleb stylestyle guidebuzzdesignersshowstimes luxuryvideosdesigner directoryNewslifestylefashionstyle-guide5 saree tips to take from South Indian 'saree queen' Samantha Ruth PrabhuTrendingIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate Countries5 saree tips to take from South Indian 'saree queen' Samantha Ruth PrabhuETimes.in /  Aug 13, 2025, 18:00 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollow us 1/7Saree lessons from the very stylish Samantha Ruth PrabhuSamantha Ruth Prabhu isn’t just a leading lady on screen, she’s a saree girl through and through. Whether she’s walking the red carpet, attending a temple visit, or promoting her latest film, Samantha has this uncanny ability to make a six-yard drape feel fresh, current, and endlessly stylish. Her Instagram alone is practically a mood board for anyone who wants to give their saree game a serious upgrade.Here’s how to take a few lessons from Samantha’s playbook and turn the humble saree into your ultimate style weapon.by TOI Lifestyle Desk 2/7​Master the art of mixing texturesOne thing Samantha does better than most is pairing contrasting textures in a way that feels intentional and luxe. You will often spot her wearing a crisp organza saree with a raw silk blouse, or a matte cotton drape with a metallic brocade blouse.The trick? The fabrics should talk to each other, not compete. If the saree has a soft, flowy drape, she’ll go for a blouse with more structure. If the saree is rich and heavy, she’ll balance it with a simpler, lighter blouse.For us mere mortals, this means stepping outside the matching-set mindset. That Kanjeevaram in your cupboard? Try pairing it with a velvet blouse for winter weddings. Got a breezy linen saree? Give it some shine with a sequin or mirror-work blouse.3/7Play with unconventional blouse stylesIf there’s one thing Samantha has taught us, it’s that the blouse can make (or break) your saree look. She isn’t afraid of experimenting, from strappy corset-style cholis to high-neck blouses with dramatic sleeves.The magic is in balancing the mood of the event with the blouse design. For traditional festivities, she leans towards elbow-length sleeves and heritage necklines. For fashion-forward occasions, she isn’t shy about trying halter necks, off-shoulder cuts, or even capes as a blouse alternative.The lesson? Think beyond the regular tailor-cut blouse. Raid Pinterest for ideas, mix in some contemporary silhouettes, and let the blouse set the tone for your entire look.4/7​Keep your jewellery intentionalSamantha’s saree looks are never weighed down with jewellery just for the sake of it. If she’s wearing a heavy, embellished saree, she’ll often let it breathe with just statement earrings. On the flip side, with simpler drapes like a plain tussar or organza, she’ll turn up the drama with chunky temple jewellery or layered necklaces.It’s about intention, not excess. Every piece she wears feels like it belongs, creating harmony instead of visual chaos.If you are styling your own saree, take a beat before reaching for the whole jewellery box. Ask yourself: is the saree the hero or the accessories? Then edit accordingly. Sometimes, less sparkle equals more impact.5/7​Nail the drape for the occasionFrom a crisp corporate pallu for a business event to a loose, casual drape for a day wedding, Samantha always tailors her saree pleats to the moment. She even experiments with belt-cinched sarees for a modern twist, a trick that works wonders for creating shape and adding a little edge.The biggest takeaway here is to treat your saree drape like styling hair or makeup: adapt it to the vibe. A tight, structured drape works for formal occasions, while a relaxed, low-pleat version feels more laid-back and bohemian.Pro tip: if you’re wearing the saree all day, make sure the pleats are pinned securely (a mishap mid-event is never chic). Samantha’s looks always appear effortless because they’re also practical, no tugging or adjusting every five minutes.6/7Let the saree reflect your moodPerhaps Samantha’s most important saree lesson is that she doesn’t wear it like a costume, she wears it like an extension of herself. Some days it’s a blush-pink floral drape that screams romantic and whimsical. Other days, it’s a strong, deep-coloured silk that says, “I mean business.”Fashion is personal, and the saree is one of the most adaptable garments in the world. Feeling playful? Go for bright colours, quirky prints, or ruffled edges. In a minimalist mood? Choose muted tones with subtle detailing.The point is: the saree isn’t just for weddings, pujas, or “special” days. Samantha wears hers to red carpets, movie promotions, and even casual brunches, proving that this centuries-old garment is as everyday-friendly as jeans if you style it right.7/7Magic of Samantha's sareesSamantha Ruth Prabhu’s saree style is the perfect blend of tradition and experimentation. She respects the garment’s heritage but refuses to treat it as untouchable. Instead, she makes it personal, modern, and infinitely wearable.So the next time you’re staring at your saree collection wondering how to make it feel fresh, remember: mix textures, play with blouse styles, be intentional with jewellery, drape for the occasion, and above all, let the saree reflect you.The magic of Samantha’s saree looks isn’t in the price tags or designer labels, it’s in the way she wears them with confidence and joy. And that, more than any styling trick, is the ultimate tip worth stealing.Follow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousSet up a mini lotus pond at home with these easy tipsindiaJanmashtami 2025: Labrador Retriever vs Beagle: Which is a better pet dog for families with children?
Are you planning to choose the right pet dog for your family? Do you have children and are thinking which popular pet dog is better-- Labrador Retriever or Beagle? Well, Labrador Retrievers and Beagles are two of the most popular breeds across the world, and both are known for their friendliness and playfulness. However, they do have certain differences that can make one dog breed more suitable for your household than the other, depending on your needs. So, here we list some key differences between the two that will help you select the right pet dog for you:
Labrador Retriever vs Beagle: Which is a better pet dog for families with children? Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior Carelove & sexworkpetssoul curryask the expertvideosNewslifestylerelationshipspetsLabrador Retriever vs Beagle: Which is a better pet dog for families with children?TrendingIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesLabrador Retriever vs Beagle: Which is a better pet dog for families with children?ETimes.in / Updated: Aug 13, 2025, 17:23 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollow us 1/8Labrador Retriever vs BeagleAre you planning to choose the right pet dog for your family? Do you have children and are thinking which popular pet dog is better-- Labrador Retriever or Beagle? Well, Labrador Retrievers and Beagles are two of the most popular breeds across the world, and both are known for their friendliness and playfulness. However, they do have certain differences that can make one dog breed more suitable for your household than the other, depending on your needs. So, here we list some key differences between the two that will help you select the right pet dog for you:2/8TemperamentLabrador Retrievers are known for being gentle, fun-loving, and patient— which makes them perfect pets for families with kids of all ages. Beagles too are friendly and playful, but they have a stronger independent streak, which can make them a bit mischievous.3/8Size and space needsThis is one of the most striing differences between the two pet dog breeds. Labradors are large and they need more space to move freely; and so, they are more suitable for people with large homes and bungalows. Whereas, due to their small size Beagles are perfect pets for people living in apartments or smaller homes.4/8Energy levelsBoth Labradors and Beagles are active, when it comes to their energy levels. But Labs need more structured exercise and outdoor play to stay active and healthy. Whereas, Beagles have bursts of high energy but can be happy with regular short walks and play sessions too.5/8 Grooming and sheddingBoth Labs and Beagles shed moderately. However, Labradors may shed a bit more seasonally. On the contrary, due to their short coats,  Beagles are easier to groom and maintain. Both the dog breeds need regular brushing to keep their coats clean and healthy.6/8TrainabilityDue to their people pleasing nature, Labradors respond well to training and positive reinforcement. This makes them great pets even for first-time owners. Beagles, on the other hand, are intelligent but can also be stubborn. And so, a person needs to handle them with a lot of patience and consistent positive reinforcement.7/8Health issuesLabradors are known to be more prone to joint issues like hip dysplasia. Meanwhile Beagles are prone to ear infections due to their floppy ears. Both the dog breeds need regular vet care to ensure they stay healthy.8/8Compatibility with kids Labradors are known for their patience and tolerance, which makes them perfect for younger children. While Beagles are equally affectionate, they may be better with slightly older kids who can match their playful energy and need for independence too at times.Follow Us On Social Media Visual Stories How to get rid of pimples overnight: Fast and natural remedies for clear skin
Dealing with a sudden pimple? This guide offers quick solutions to reduce its size and redness overnight. It combines natural remedies like tea tree oil and aloe vera with over-the-counter treatments containing salicylic acid. Also, it emphasizes the importance of gentle skincare and avoiding harsh treatments to protect your skin's health.
How to get rid of pimples overnight: Fast and natural remedies for clear skin | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipbeautyHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior CareNewslifestylebeautyHow to get rid of pimples overnight: Fast and natural remedies for clear skinTrendingIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesHow to get rid of pimples overnight: Fast and natural remedies for clear skinTOI Lifestyle Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 13, 2025, 14:59 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeDealing with a sudden pimple? This guide offers quick solutions to reduce its size and redness overnight. It combines natural remedies like tea tree oil and aloe vera with over-the-counter treatments containing salicylic acid. Also, it emphasizes the importance of gentle skincare and avoiding harsh treatments to protect your skin's health.  Waking up with a pimple can be incredibly frustrating, especially when you have an important meeting, party, or photoshoot lined up. That angry red bump can feel like it’s stealing all the attention, and the urge to make it disappear instantly is understandable. While completely eliminating a pimple overnight is nearly impossible, there are tried-and-tested methods to significantly reduce its size, redness, and inflammation in just a few hours. By combining natural ingredients, simple home treatments, and targeted over-the-counter products, you can calm irritation, shrink swelling, and make your skin look noticeably smoother by morning.The key lies in choosing remedies that work quickly without damaging your skin barrier because harsh treatments can sometimes make things worse. From ice therapy and spot treatments to soothing herbal options, there are safe, effective ways to give your skin the overnight boost it needs. Here’s a detailed, step-by-step guide on how to remove pimples overnight while protecting your skin’s health.Natural remedies to remove pimples overnightTea tree oil spot treatmentStudies by NIH show that tea tree oil is a potent antibacterial and anti-inflammatory agent. It helps fight the bacteria that cause pimples, reduces redness, soothes swelling, and can accelerate the healing process, making breakouts less noticeable and preventing future flare-ups when used correctly.How to use: Dilute a few drops in a carrier oil like coconut or jojoba oil. Apply directly to the affected area before bedtime.Aloe vera gelResearch done by NIH confirms that aloe vera is renowned for its soothing and anti-inflammatory properties. Applying fresh aloe gel to pimples can calm redness, reduce swelling, and promote healing overnight.How to use: Extract fresh gel from an aloe leaf and apply a thin layer to the pimple before sleeping. Wash off in the morning with lukewarm water.Ice compressCold therapy is an easy way to reduce puffiness and redness. Ice constricts blood vessels and reduces inflammation.How to use: Wrap a small ice cube in a clean cloth and gently press it against the pimple for 3–5 minutes. Repeat 2–3 times.Honey and cinnamon maskAccording to research published in Research Gate, honey and cinnamon have natural antibacterial and antimicrobial properties. Together, they can help fight bacteria and soothe irritated skin.How to use: Mix 1 teaspoon of honey with ½ teaspoon of cinnamon to form a paste. Apply directly to the pimple and leave it on overnight. Wash off in the morning.Over-the-counter spot treatmentsProducts containing salicylic acid or benzoyl peroxide are widely recommended by dermatologists. They work by unclogging pores, drying out excess oil, and killing bacteria.How to use: Apply a small amount to the pimple as directed on the product label. Avoid overuse, as these ingredients can irritate skin if applied too heavily.Tips to reduce pimples fasterAvoid touching your face: Your hands carry bacteria that can worsen pimples.Keep skin clean: Gently cleanse your face twice daily with a mild cleanser.Use non-comedogenic products: Choose skincare and makeup products that won’t clog pores.Stay hydrated: Drinking water helps flush out toxins and supports skin healing.Get enough sleep: Rest allows your body to repair and rejuvenate skin overnight.Pimples form when excess oil, dead skin cells, and bacteria clog pores. The sooner you treat them, the faster you can reduce swelling and prevent further inflammation. Overnight treatments work by soothing the skin, targeting bacteria, and drying out excess oil, all of which help the pimple heal faster.While no remedy can completely erase pimples overnight, combining these treatments with consistent skincare habits can significantly reduce their appearance. If breakouts persist or worsen, it’s always best to consult a dermatologist for tailored advice. By following these tips, you can wake up to calmer, less inflamed skin and keep your complexion healthy and glowing.Also read| 5 common mistakes older women make that worsen hair lossAbout the AuthorTOI Lifestyle DeskThe TOI Lifestyle Desk is a dynamic team of dedicated journalists who, with unwavering passion and commitment, sift through the pulse of the nation to curate a vibrant tapestry of lifestyle news for The Times of India readers. At the TOI Lifestyle Desk, we go beyond the obvious, delving into the extraordinary. Consider us your lifestyle companion, providing a daily dose of inspiration and information. Whether you're seeking the latest fashion trends, travel escapades, culinary delights, or wellness tips, the TOI Lifestyle Desk is your one-stop destination for an enriching lifestyle experience.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousSet up a mini lotus pond at home with these easy tipsLifestyleAttractive looks of Srithika Saneeshtv10 creatures that can walk on waterLifestyleSheet masks out, Kareena Kapoor Khan’s DIY napkin mask inLifestyleBhagyashri Borse charms with her gorgeous outfitsEntertainmentMost affordable diesel cars under Rs 12 lakh: Kia Syros, Mahindra Thar and moreautoThese Zodiac Signs Play the Victim When They’re Actually in Controlastrology10 things to know before getting a pet rabbitLifestyleDiarrhea: What to eat and avoid when the stomach is upsetLifestyleTaarak Mehta fame Palak Sindhwani’s top 10 gorgeous outfitstv Next123 Photostories  Labrador Retriever vs Beagle: Which is a better pet dog for families with children?'Coolie': Five big reasons to experience Rajinikanth and Lokesh Kanagaraj’s film on the big screenCooku With Comali 6: From Shabana Shajahan to Lakshmy Ramakrishnan – Meet the top 6 cooks of the seasonAnanya Panday moments that show her unstoppable rise to stardom7 brain-boosting foods every child should eat and quick recipes8.5 quintals of adulterated mawa seized in Hisar: 5 ways to do mawa purity test at homeFrom reunion with Asit Kumar Modi to unseen pictures: Times when Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah’s Disha Vakani aka Dayaben made headlinesThis is what happens when you drink fennel tea on an empty stomachBoney Kapoor celebrates wife Sridevi's 62nd birth anniversary; How to reduce face fat naturally: A simple diet and exercise routine
Anushka Vyas shared her secrets to a slimmer face on Instagram. She cut out dairy and ate high-fiber foods. She also did facial exercises. These changes helped her get a more sculpted look. Eliminating dairy reduces bloating. Fiber-rich foods aid weight management. Chewing hard foods tones facial muscles. Detox juices and hydration are important. Regular facial exercises improve muscle tone.
How to reduce face fat naturally: A simple diet and exercise routine | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior Carehealth newsfitnessdietmental healthcoronavirusalternative therapiesweight lossvideosdiseasesyogaNewslifestylehealth-fitnesshealth-newsHow to reduce face fat naturally: A simple diet and exercise routineTrendingIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day 2025Cristiano RonaldoKidney DamageMeghan MarkleHeart AttackGuava Leaf TeaMichael DouglasHigh Uric Acid SymptomsMango BenefitsHighest Inflation Rate CountriesHow to reduce face fat naturally: A simple diet and exercise routineTOI Lifestyle Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 13, 2025, 17:00 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAnushka Vyas shared her secrets to a slimmer face on Instagram. She cut out dairy and ate high-fiber foods. She also did facial exercises. These changes helped her get a more sculpted look. Eliminating dairy reduces bloating. Fiber-rich foods aid weight management. Chewing hard foods tones facial muscles. Detox juices and hydration are important. Regular facial exercises improve muscle tone.  Waking up to a puffy face or noticing extra roundness in your cheeks can be frustrating, especially when you want a more sculpted, defined look. While genetics and overall body weight play a role in facial fat, lifestyle choices such as diet, hydration, and targeted exercises can make a significant difference. In her July 30 Instagram post, Anushka Vyas shared the diet and exercise routine that helped her achieve a slimmer, more sculpted face. Her approach focused on cutting out dairy, eating high-fiber foods, and practicing facial exercises to tone muscles. By making these manageable changes, she achieved noticeable results, proving that natural methods can work wonders when followed consistently.Many people tend to overlook the fact that reducing facial fat requires a holistic approach rather than relying on spot reduction alone. While some quick fixes might temporarily reduce puffiness, sustainable results come from combining the right nutrition, hydration, and muscle-toning exercises.Simple diet and exercise tips to slim your faceEliminate dairy from your dietAnushka’s most impactful dietary change was cutting out dairy completely. Dairy products like milk, cheese, and yogurt can sometimes lead to water retention and bloating, making the face appear puffier than it actually is. By eliminating dairy, she noticed a significant reduction in facial bloating within a few weeks.Tip: Replace dairy with plant-based alternatives like almond milk, soy milk, or oat milk.Why it works: Less water retention means a naturally leaner, more contoured look.Include high-fiber foodsFiber-rich foods are essential for overall weight management, which also helps reduce facial fat. Anushka emphasizes the importance of including foods like spinach, kale, beetroot, berries, and apples. These help you feel fuller for longer, preventing overeating and unnecessary snacking.Tip: Add leafy greens to every meal and snack on fruits like apples or berries throughout the day.Benefit: High-fiber foods support digestion and help flush out toxins, indirectly contributing to a slimmer facial appearance.Eat hard-to-chew foodsOne of Anushka’s secrets is foods that require more chewing, which helps tone the jaw and cheek muscles over time. By engaging facial muscles regularly, these foods stimulate muscle tone and improve definition, giving your face a naturally sculpted look without invasive procedures.Tip: Include crunchy, fiber-rich foods like raw vegetables, nuts, and corn in your diet to engage facial muscles regularly. Benefit: This stimulates muscle tone and improves definition, giving your face a naturally sculpted look without any invasive procedures.Stay hydrated with detox juicesHydration plays a vital role in reducing puffiness and supporting overall health. Anushka suggests detox juices to flush out toxins and prevent water retention.Detox juice recipe:One slice of petha (winter squash)1 tsp turmeric (haldi)Juice of half a cucumberOne twig of meetha neem (curry leaves)Drinking this combination regularly can aid digestion, reduce bloating, and promote a slimmer facial appearance.Practice facial exercisesWhile spot reduction isn’t possible, certain facial exercises help tone muscles, improving overall definition. Anushka includes exercises that target the jawline, cheeks, and neck. Regular facial exercises improve blood circulation, tighten skin, and prevent sagging, giving your face a naturally toned and youthful look.Tip: Practice these exercises for 10–15 minutes daily to see noticeable results. Benefit: Regular practice strengthens and sculpts facial muscles, enhancing your natural facial contours over time.Other lifestyle tips to reduce face fatBeyond diet and exercises, several habits can further help reduce facial fat:Limit salt intake: Excess salt causes water retention and puffiness.Avoid processed sugar: High sugar consumption contributes to fat accumulation and inflammation.Sleep well: Adequate sleep reduces stress and cortisol, which can cause facial bloating.Stay active: Overall body fat reduction through cardio or strength training reflects on your face too.Combining these habits with Anushka’s routine ensures faster and sustainable results.Reducing face fat naturally is entirely achievable with the right combination of diet, hydration, and facial exercises. As Anushka Vyas demonstrated in her July 30 Instagram post, cutting out dairy, eating fiber-rich and hard-to-chew foods, staying hydrated with detox juices, and practicing targeted facial exercises can dramatically improve facial appearance.Consistency is key. While changes won’t happen overnight, following this routine regularly can help you achieve a slimmer, more sculpted face safely and naturally. Always remember to consult a healthcare professional before making significant changes to your diet or exercise routine, especially if you have pre-existing health conditions. By incorporating these tips, you can not only reduce face fat but also improve your overall health, confidence, and well-being.Disclaimer: This article is for general informational purposes only and is not a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Always seek the guidance of a qualified healthcare provider regarding any medical condition or lifestyle change.Also read| 10 Everyday habits that could be secretly damaging your brain functionAbout the AuthorTOI Lifestyle DeskThe TOI Lifestyle Desk is a dynamic team of dedicated journalists who, with unwavering passion and commitment, sift through the pulse of the nation to curate a vibrant tapestry of lifestyle news for The Times of India readers. At the TOI Lifestyle Desk, we go beyond the obvious, delving into the extraordinary. Consider us your lifestyle companion, providing a daily dose of inspiration and information. Whether you're seeking the latest fashion trends, travel escapades, culinary delights, or wellness tips, the TOI Lifestyle Desk is your one-stop destination for an enriching lifestyle experience.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousAttractive looks of Srithika Saneeshtv10 creatures that can walk on waterLifestyleSheet masks out, Kareena Kapoor Khan’s DIY napkin mask inLifestyleBhagyashri Borse charms with her gorgeous outfitsEntertainmentMost affordable diesel cars under Rs 12 lakh: Kia Syros, Mahindra Thar and moreautoThese Zodiac Signs Play the Victim When They’re Actually in Controlastrology10 things to know before getting a pet rabbitLifestyleDiarrhea: What to eat and avoid when the stomach is upsetLifestyleTaarak Mehta fame Palak Sindhwani’s top 10 gorgeous outfitstv10 loving things to tell a child before bedtimeLifestyle Next123 Photostories  'Coolie': Five big reasons to experience Rajinikanth and Lokesh Kanagaraj’s film on the big screenCooku With Comali 6: From Shabana Shajahan to Lakshmy Ramakrishnan – Meet the top 6 cooks of the seasonAnanya Panday moments that show her unstoppable rise to stardom7 brain-boosting foods every child should eat and quick recipes8.5 quintals of adulterated mawa seized in Hisar: 5 ways to do mawa purity test at homeFrom reunion with Asit Kumar Modi to unseen pictures: Times when Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah’s Disha Vakani aka Dayaben made headlinesThis is what happens when you drink fennel tea on an empty stomachBoney Kapoor celebrates wife Sridevi's 62nd birth anniversary;
